title: Implementation of Non- local Means Image Denoising on Embedded System
abstract: Non-local means filtering is an effective image denoising technique. However, conventional algorithms generally require large storage space and high clock rates, therefore unsuitable for the implementation on an embedded system. In this study, a simplified non- local means denoising algorithm is described, which significantly reduces computational complexity with little loss of image quality. Image acquisition, non-local means denoising, and image display are implemented on an embedded system using S 3 C 6410 processor based on ARM 11 and Windows CE. Both real- time operation and miniaturization are realized. Experiments show the system has satisfactory denoising performance.

title: Comparative Study of the Functional Coating of Water Erosion Prepared by DS and HVOF [J]
abstract: Two kinds of spraying technology of anti-erosion used in last stage blades of steam turbine was introduced; the microstructure and the properties of coatings obtained by the two kinds of spraying technology; the application performances of two kinds of spraying technology were compared by Erosion experiments. the theoretical basis is provided for domestic HVOF technology replacing the foreign DS technology in the future, achieving the localization of the spray coatings for turbine blades.

title: Comparison Study on Extraction of Pectin from Orange Peel by Ammonium Oxalate and Mixing-Salting Out Method [J]
abstract: Applied local orange peel in Hanzhong as experimental material, the comparison extracted research of pectin from orange peel by ammonium oxalate and mixing-salting out methods was carried out. The results showed that by ammonium oxalate method, under the best extraction process conditions of extraction temperature 80Γäâ, ammonium oxalate mass fraction 0.8%, the ratio of solvent to material 1Γê╢ 30 and extraction time 1.5 h, the pectin yield was 35.6%, while the pectin extraction rate was 8.1% by mixing-salting out method under the extraction temperature 80Γäâ, the ratio of mixing-salt 12Γê╢ 1, solvent to material ratio 1Γê╢ 30, extraction time 1.5 h and pH value 7. So ammonium oxalate was suggested to be used in industrial extraction of pectin from orange peel.

title: Adaptive Target Tracking Algorithm based on Texture and Color
abstract: Particle filter tracking algorithm is generally used in tracking moving targets. In order to reduce the effect of similar background pixels and the light changes on maneuvering target tracking, the article uses adaptive particle filtering algorithm based on a target texture features, which is mixed with color features. By the help of different status transition model and observation model, this algorithm can select adaptively track target depending on the different track environment, and gives corresponding results. Test result shows that the algorithm in tracking performance and robustness has great improvement.

title: Research on the Temporal and Spatial Distribution Characteristics of API in Shanghai
abstract: API (Air Pollution Index) is a comprehensive index which reflects and evaluates air quality and is classified to represent air quality and pollution condition. According to the API of different districts in Shanghai during 2006~ 2011 collected from Shanghai Environmental Monitoring Center, time series and spatial analysis are conducted which included annual changes, seasonal changes and comparison on urban and suburban API value during past 6 years. The results showed that the air condition of Shanghai had improved. The air quality was the best in summer and the worst in spring. Spatially, the air quality is different in rural area and urban area. The API in the suburban was better than that in the urban. The air quality in Jinshan district was the best while it was quite worse in Putuo and Baoshan district.

title: Epidemiological and clinical analysis of two cases of imported pernicious malaria
abstract: Objective To study epidemiological and clinical features of imported pernicious malaria. Methods Epidemiological data, clinical manifestations, laboratory examinations, diagnosis and treatments of 2 cases of patient with pernicious malaria hospitalized in this hospital in October, 2010 to July, 2012 in this hospital were retrospective analysis. Results One patient was a middle-aged labor man returning from Africa, and the other young man had been to the Shanghai Expo. All of them were with anemia, splenomegaly and liver dysfunction. One patient developed leucopenia, and the other one developed thrombocytopenia. After antimalarial treatment, both of them were cured in the short term (1-2 weeks). Conclusion Patients with imported pernicious malaria might be with complex clinical manifestations. According to individuals return from Africa or from affected areas, clinical staff should combine the epidemiological and clinical characteristics, take high degree of vigilance of imported pernicious malaria, perform peripheral blood smear timely, find plasmodium seriously, confirm the diagnosis, take antimalarial treatment and avoid dangerous malaria occurrence.

title: Application of improved decision-making model in filtering phone spam messages
abstract: A phone spam messages filtering is discussed. As the traditional phone filtering method uses the two-branch decision-making model, but causes a large decision loss, an improved decision-making model is put for ward, namely the three-branch decision-making model, then in theory, it proves the model causes less loss than the two-branch one, at last tries to apply the improved model into filter phone spam messages. The test result shows that the three-branch decision-making model actually causes less loss than the two-branch one, and gets better classification effect. So the three-branch decision-making model is superior and more effective.

title: Simulation and experimental study on charge and discharge characteristics of battery
abstract: Based on the three-order battery model, a simulation model has been built to study the charge and discharge characteristics of the lead-acid battery. This paper proposes a novel physical method which combines power electronic devices and computer simulation system to simulate the actual battery charge and discharge system. Simulation and experimental results are presented to validate that the proposed model and physical simulation platform are effective, which provides the reference to the study of the characteristics of charging and discharging on lead-acid battery.

title: Impact of simvastatin on microthrombosis in cortical after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats and its mechanism
abstract: OBJECTIVE: Accumulating evidence demonstrates that subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH)-induced microthrombosis plays important roles in the pathogenesis of delayed cerebral ischemia. The purpose of the present study was to determine the impact of simvastatin on microthrombi formation and cerebral vasospasm after SAH and explore its mechanism. METHODS: A total of 24 adult male SD rats were divided into 4 groups:(1) control group (n= 6);(2) SAH group (n= 6);(3) SAH+ vehicle group (n= 6) and (4) SAH+ simvastatin group (n= 6). SAH was induced by injecting 0.3 ml of fresh arterial, non-heparinized blood into prechiasmatic cistern in 20 sec with a syringe pump. In the SAH+ simvastatin group, simvastatin was administered ip at a dose of 20 mg├ù kg (-1)├ù d (-1) after SAH. Brain samples were excised after perfusion fixation at 7 days post-SAH. Microclots were evaluated by H&E staining. Microthrombi formation was measured by fibrinogen immunostaining. RESULTS: The number of microthrombi was 1┬▒1, 25┬▒5, 24┬▒4 and 5┬▒2 in control, SAH, vehicle and simvastatin groups respectively. The number of microthrombi significantly increased in cerebral cortex at 7 days post-SAH (P< 0.01). The treatment of simvastatin down-regulated the formation of microclots in the SAH model and the number of microthrombi decreased significantly in the SAH+ simvastatin group as compared with the SAH or SAH+ vehicle groups (P< 0.01). CONCLUSION: The administration of simvastatin alleviates microthrombosis in late phase of SAH in this prechiasmatic blood injection model.

title: Pris at trec2012 contextual suggestion track
abstract: The system to Contextual Suggestion Track at TREC2012 includes information crawling and preprocessing, context filtering, user modeling, similarity computing and ranking, description generating. Some third party tool kits are used, such as URLPARSE. TF-IDF term frequency-inverse document frequency and cosine similarity is also used for building user models and computed similarities between users and candidate items.Descriptors:

title: Establishment of a highly efficient in vitro regeneration system for Chinese kale (Brassica oleracea L. var. alboglabra)
abstract: The effects of different combinations and concentrations of plant growth regulators on differentiation frequency were studied using hypocotyls, cotyledons, and flamingo-bills as explants to establish an effective in vitroregeneration system for Chinese kale. The results showed that hypocotyls on a culture medium consisting of Murashige and Skoog (MS) medium + 1% sucrose + 2.0 mg/L BAP + 7.0 mg/L AgNO3 achieved a differentiation frequency of 86.7%. The differentiation frequency of cotyledons on MS + 3% sucrose + 2.0 mg/L BAP + 0.40 mg/L NAA + 5.0 mg/L AgNO3 was 94.0%. Flamingo-bills produced shoots on MS + 3% sucrose + 2 mg/L BAP, and the average number of shoots obtained per explant was 4.5. Adventitious shoots produced roots when inoculated on MS + 0.2 mg/L NAA.       Key words: Chinese kale, regeneration, differentiation, hypocotyl, cotyledon, flamingo-bill.

title: The recognition study of impulse and oscillation transient based on spectral kurtosis and neural network
abstract: To improve the precision of classification and recognition of transient power quality disturbances, a new algorithm based on spectral kurtosis (SK) and neural network is proposed. In the proposed algorithm, Morlet complex wavelet is used to obtain the WT-based SK of two kinds of disturbances, such as the impulse transient and oscillation transient. Two characteristic quantities, i.e., the maximum value of SK and the frequencies of the signals, are chosen as the input of neural network for the classification and recognition of transient power quality disturbances. Simulation results show that the transient disturbance characteristics can be effectively extracted by WT-based SK. With RBF neural network, the two kinds of transient disturbances can be effectively classified and recognized with the method in the paper.

title: Surgery for jugular foramen schwannomas via a pure endoscopic transoral approach
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To report a new approach, endoscopic transoral approach for the resection of jugular foramen schwannoma. METHODS: Nine patients with jugular foramen schwannoma (three males and six females, ranging in age from 15 to 61 years old) were treated by direct surgery via a pure endoscopic transoral approach to the jugular foramen. Eight patients complained of hypoglossal nerve palsy with hemiatrophy of the tongue; six cases complained of vagus nerve palsy. Three cases complained of glossopharyngeal nerve palsy, one case complained of facial nerve palsy and hearing loss. RESULTS: The nerves in this area were preserved and radical intracapsular removal of the tumor was performed via endoscopic transoral approach in the nine cases. Tumor removal, as assessed by intraoperative endoscopic inspection, postoperative magnetic resonance imaging and clinical evaluation, revealed all tumors were completely removed. One patient suffered from temporary swallowing difficulties and temporary right vagus palsy 1 day after surgery. There were no others intraoperative and postoperative complications. All patients were followed up for 4-29 months, no recurrences were occurred in all these patients and the muscle bulk, motor and the pre-postoperative swallowing function, the vagus palsy, the facial nerve palsy and hearing loss had improved in these patients. CONCLUSION: The endoscopic transoral approach and intracapsular removal of the tumor provided for successful minimally invasive surgery in the jugular foramen schwannomas.

title: Identification of Dens Draconis and Os Draconis by XRD method
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To establish an XRD method for evaluating the quality of Os Draconis and Dens Draconis and applying in judgement of the counterfeit. METHODS: Dens Draconis, Os Draconis and the counterfeit of Os Draconis were analyzed by XRD. Their diffraction patterns were clustered analysis and evaluated their similarity degree. RESULTS: Established the analytical method of Dens Draconis and Os Draconis basing the features fingerprint information of the 10 common peaks by XRD pattern. Obtained the XRD pattern of the counterfeit of Os Draconis. The similarity degree of separate sources of Dens Draconis was high, while the similarity degree of separate sources of Os Draconis was significant different from each other. CONCLUSION: This method can be used for identification and evaluation of Os Draconis and Dens Draconis. It also can be used for identification the counterfeit of Os Draconis effectively.

title: Improvement of method to produce septic shock model of rats
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To investigate the feasibility of method improved for developing septic shock rats model. METHODS: Studies were performed on 60 adult male Sprague-Dawley rats. They were randomized into sham group and standard CLP (J Group) group (n= 20), A (n= 10), B (n= 10), C (n= 10) group and J group was further to two subgroups (n= 10) J1 and J2 group. The ligated distance of A, B and C group were 20%, 30%, 50% of the cecum respectively. Standard CLP procedures were made in J group as described previously. Sham group just sham operated. MAP was monitored continuously in A, B, C and J1 groups for 5h, and the MAP dropped to 70% of the baseline was defined as septic shock, MAP was monitored for more than 10 hours until it reached 70% of baseline or lower in the J2 group. The white blood cell count, endotoxin and histopathological changes in lung and renal tissue were observed in each groups. RESULTS: At 5h after operation, there is no change of MAP in sham, J1, A and B groups, but it dropped to 70% of the baseline [(73┬▒10) mmHg] in C group. Compared with sham group, the level of endotoxin [(17┬▒5) vs (456┬▒28) vs (596┬▒29) vs (982┬▒11) vs (209┬▒40) pg/ml] and white cell count [(6.3┬▒3.7) vs (4.6┬▒1.4) vs (3.7┬▒1.2) vs (3.3┬▒2.6) vs (4.2┬▒1.2)├ù 10 (9)/L] was significantly higher and lower respectively in A, B, C and J1 groups. Obvious pulmonary and nephridia tissue edema, inflammatory cell infiltration was observed in C group, but the inflammatory cell infiltration was not found in A, B and J1 groups, The manifestations of J2 group rats is similar with C group. CONCLUSIONS: The rat model produced by ligating 50┬áΓÇª

title: Solidification Analysis during Laser Cladding Process Based on Finite ElementεÇâ
abstract: Finite element was used to analyze effects of the temperature variations on the solidification organization for laser cladding. The influences of the temperature gradient G and the cooling rate (cooling part of temperature changing rate) were discussed. A feature controlling factor K was used to study the solidification performance in the laser cladding process. The results show that the grains precipitate along the vertical direction below the heat source center and the cooling rate plays an important role in refining the grains. The larger the cooling rate is, the less the grains are. It is also found that the solidification structure is significantly dependent on the occurring time of the highest cooling rate and on that of K at the melting point of the cladding or the substrate. It is demonstrated that, if the largest cooling rate is achieved prior to K at the melting point, the structure is of the cellular-grain form. Otherwise, it is of column-dendrite grain form. And when K is in the range of 80├ù 10 6~ 120├ù 10 6Γäâ┬╖ s, the solidification structure is of densely arranged cellular-grain form whose grain size is larger. When K is more than

title: Dynamically monitor of serum HCG, PROG, E2 and CA125 in patients with threatened abortion
abstract: Objective To investigate the dynamic changes of serum human chorionic gonadotrophin (HCG), progesterone,(PROG), estradiol (E2) and CA125 in patients with threatened abortion, and to evaluate their prognostic values. Methods 23 healthy adults and 61 patients with threatened abortion were examined in this study. The levels of serum HCG, PROG, E2 and CA125 were determined. Results Before the treatment, the concentration of HCG, PROG, E2 and CA125 in the threatened abortion group was (6 542.4┬▒3 769.5) mIU/ml,(19.1┬▒6.7) ng/ml,(484.6┬▒318.2) pg/ml and (36.8┬▒19.3) U/ml, respectively. The levels of HCG, PROG, E2 and CA125 in threatened abortion group were significantly different from the control group (P0. 05). During the treatment, the levels of HCG, PROG, E2 and CA125 significantly different from the perstetur pregnancy group. Conclusion Serum HCG, PROG, E2 and CA125 were useful in the monitoring of patients with threatened abortion.

title: Warm Extrusion Forming Process and Die Design for Shaft Cover
abstract: In order to get the method and process to effectively forming the shaft cover, the structural characteristics of the shaft cover were analyzed, the warm extrusion process was constituted, the height of the mandrel part of the top die was less than 61mm. At last, the forming die was designed.

title: Research Status of Aluminized and Aluminum Alloy Coating on Surface of Magnesium Alloy
abstract: The international research on the protective characters of the aluminum coating and aluminum alloy on the surface of magnesium alloy was summarized. The progress of aluminized, magnetron sputtering, cold spraying and thermal spraying methods to prepare the aluminum coating and the research results were introduced.

title: Preparation and stuctural behavior of the inclusion complex of beta-cyclodextrin and coptisine hydrochloride
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To optimize the preparation of Coptisine hydrochloride/beta-cyclodextrin (beta-CD) inclusion complex and analyze the structure of the inclusion complex. METHODS: With encapsulation rate as the index of evaluation, different factors influencing the inclusion complex eg temperature, inclusion time and cooling time were investigated; UV-vis, DSC, 1H-NMR, and solubilization experiment were utilized to analyze the inclusion complex. RESULTS: The optimum process was as follows: coptisine hydrochloride: beta-CD (mol/mol)= 1: 2, 40 degrees C, agitating for 2h and then cooling for 3d. Inclusion rate was 90. 64%. Various characterization results showed that the inclusion equilibrium constant Ka was 3.11 x 10 (6) M (-1) at 298K, the benzene ring of coptisine hydrochloride was included into the cavity of beta-CD, furthermore, the thermal stability and water-solubility of coptisine hydrochloride was improved when it was included with beta-CD. CONCLUSION: The 2: 1 (molar ratio) complexes between beta-CD and coptisine hydrochloride is formed, which improves the bioavailability of coptisine hydrochloride.

title: In Silicon Cloning and Bioinformatic Analysis of Ascorbate Peroxidase Gene in Helianthus annuus [J]
abstract: Using in silicon cloning, the cDNA of ascorbate peroxidase (APX) was cloned from Helianthus annuus with the full length as 753 bp. The bioinformatic analysis showed that the HaAPX shared a high similarity with that of other species in DNA and protein level, possessing the domains of Peroxidase_1 (-divtlsggHtl-) and Peroxidase_2 (-aplmlRlawHsa-), as well as the ligand-binding sites and metal-binding sites were extremely conserved. HaAPX was closer to APX of Ipomoea batatas in the phylogenetic tree. HaAPX encoded a protein of 250 amino acids with the molecular weight as 2.7 ku. The signal peptide and trans-membrane region were not found in the protein sequence. The protein contains 37.6% of ╬▒-helix, 13.2% of ╬▓-sheet, 9.2% of ╬▓-turns and 40% of random coil. The 3-D conformation of HaAPX protein was in accordance with APX of Pisum sativum.[Fund]: σå£Σ╕ÜΘâ¿ ΓÇ£σ╝òΦ┐¢σ¢╜ΘÖàσàêΦ┐¢σå£Σ╕Üτºæσ¡ªµèÇµ£»ΓÇ¥(2010-Z24);; Φ╜¼σƒ║σ¢áτöƒτë⌐µû░σôüτºìσƒ╣Φé▓ΘçìσñºΣ╕ôΘí╣ (2009ZX08-002-17B);; σ¢╜σ«╢Φç¬τä╢τºæσ¡ªσƒ║ΘçæΘí╣τ¢« (30871516, 30871515)

title: Study on Removing Sulphide From Drilling Fluid by Oxidation [J]
abstract: Desulfuration efficiency of H2O2, K2S2O8 and (NH4) 2S2O8 for drilling fluid were studied. Effects of Fe2+, its feeding mode and H2O2 dosage on the desulfuration efficiency of H2O2 were analyzed. The results show that when the Fe2+ and H2O2 are added in turn and the molar ratio of H2O2 to Na2S is 2∩╕░ 1, the desulfuration efficiency reaches to 55%; The desulfuration efficiencies of K2S2O8 and (NH4) 2S2O8 are higher than that of H2O2, and the highest desulfuration efficiency of K2S2O8 is 86%.

title: Influence Analysis of Process Parameters on Warpage of Injection-Molded Parts [J]
abstract: On assembly of plastic parts, the warpage of the assembled parts was one of the most important indicators for evaluation; But the process parameters including packing pressure, packing time, mold temperature and melt temperature had complicated influence on the warpage and final products size. Therefore, the influence of the warpage from the injection molding process parameters was analyzed and fractal influence from the various parameters on the warpage of injection molded parts was compared by the Moldflow software system. The result showed that when the packing pressure and melt temperature increased, the warpage increased, and packing time and mold temperature increased, the warpage reduced, And among the four process parameters, packing pressure had the most impact on warpage of injection-molded parts.

title: FEA of Anti-Glare Board Based Moldflow and ANSYS Softwares
abstract: By designing three kinds of anti-glare board with different gate locations and numbers and using Moldflow software to simulate the inject-molding process, the paper acquire accurate material properties and residual stress of each finite element respectively, and analyzed the structure stress with ANSYS software. The results show that the number and location of the gate will affect the fiber orientation and weld lines of injection molded parts, then affect the stress distribution and deformation. Therefore, for more precise analysis results of the stress and deformation, the injection molding processing parameters and mold design must be considerated.

title: Derivation and Application for Calculation of Carbon Content in Austenitizing of Cast Iron
abstract: In this paper, a formula for the calculation of carbon content during austenitizing of cast iron was deduced, considering the effect of silicon content. According to this formula, carbon content of austenite at a certain austenization temperature for a cast iron with given composition can be easily calculated, and the austenization temperature for getting the expected carbon content in the austenite can also be determined. Besides, according to the relationship between austenization temperature T x and the according carbon content C ax, and considering the effect of silicon content, the carbon content of the austenite in the commonly used cast iron during heat treatment was calculated. The formula can be as a theoretical basis for determined austenization temperature and carbon content in austenite during heat treatment of cast iron, in particular, can play an important role in heat treatment of austempered ductile iron┬áΓÇª

title: Safety interlock implementation of top-up operation in the SSRF control system
abstract: The SSRF [1] has performed two years stable operation on decay mode. In order to realize the top-up operation, the upgrade of control system has been carried out for top-up trial run. Control system sets up the operation mode control center and accomplishes the upgrading of the MPS system. According to the requirements of the physical design, control system accomplished the design and implementation of the interface for interoperate with PPS system, beam diagnosis system and power supply system and set up the interlocks of the radiation dose, energy, injection efficiency, beam current and beam life in top-up mode. The kernel of top-up operation safety interlock system is based on hardware interlock system and also provides software interlocking as auxiliary. In the meantime, the reliability of software interlock has been improved.

title: Effect and practice of the information system in the management and monitoring of hospital clinical antibacterials
abstract: Objective: To improve the management and monitoring of antibacterial clinical application at hospitals. Methods: To explore the development of information-based technologies such as classification management of antibacterials, perioperative use of antimicrobials, appraisal and monitoring of prescription, and so on. Results: The proportion of antimicrobial prescription use has gradually declined. The proportion and the duration of antimicrobial prophylactic use at type Γàáincision operation have become more standard and reasonable. The monitoring of antibacterials has become more timely and effective. Conclusion: Clinical use of antimicrobials has been timely and effectively standardized at Ruijin Hospital and tended to be rational. Medical resources have been effectively declined, which has greatly improved work efficiency and control effect of the pharmaceutical administration.

title: Expression of mRNAs missing in metastasis in primary breast carcinoma and its clinical significance
abstract: Objective: To detect the expression of" missing in metastasis (MIM) mRNA" in human primary breast carcinoma and to evaluate its correlation with clinicopathological features. Methods: The expression of MIM mRNA was detected by SYBR Green quantitative real-time PCR in 60 samples of primary breast carcinoma and adjacent normal tissues, and its expression level was interpreted in terms of various clinical characteristics. Results: The expression of MIM mRNA in breast carcinoma was higher than that of adjacent tissues (P0. 05) and it was associated with lymph node metastasis (P0. 01), tumor size, and TNM stages (P0. 05), but not age, histological grade, pathological type, ER, PR, CerbB-2 and Ki-67 (P0. 05). Conclusion: Overexpression of MIM mRNA may be a useful marker to predict metastasis of breast carcinoma. It may served as a biomarker for the prediction of moderate or advanced breast carcinoma, and may also prove to be a potential therapeutic target in breast carcinoma.

title: Downregulation of FLna and RUNx3 expression are involved in the progression of colorectal adenocarcinoma disease
abstract: To study the expressions of Filamin A (FLNa) and RUNx3 in human Colorectal Adenocarcinoma (CRA) tissues and explore their correlation with the initiation and progression of colorectal adenocarcinoma. The expression levels of FLNa and RUNx3 protein in the samples which came from 80 patients of CRA tissues and adjacent normal colorectal tissues (10 cm distance away from the margin of CRA) were examined by using immunohistochemical Streptavidin-Peroxidase (S-P) Method, Western-blotting and Reverse Transcription Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR). The correlation between their expression and the clinic pathologic features was analyzed. The positive rates of FLNa and RUNx3 in CRA tissues were 52.5% (42/80) and 46.3% (37/80), respectively while in adjacent normal colorectal tissues they were 87.5% (70/80) and 91.3% (73/80), respectively. The difference was significant (p<0.0000┬áΓÇª

title: Effects of Brain Shu Capsule on the IL-6 and TNF-╬▒ Levels in Peripheral Blood of Patients with Alzheimer Disease [J]
abstract: Objective: To investigate the brain Shu capsule on the IL-6 and TNF-╬▒ levels in peripheral blood of patients with Alzheimer disease and to observe the clinical effect of spironolactone brain. Methods: The course of the disease by age and clinical conditions will be essentially the same patients were randomly divided into two groups: control group (15 cases); observation group (l22 cases). ELISA was used to detect serum IL-6 and TNF-╬▒ levels. Scale used for the MMSE, ADL, Pfeffer Functional Activities Questionnaire (POD), Fuld Object Memory Test (FOM), fast Vocabulary Test (RVR) Assessment of clinical efficacy in into the group. Results: The peripheral blood of patients before treatment, IL-6 was (310┬▒34) ng/ml, after treatment, IL-6 in peripheral blood was (270┬▒21) ng/ml, no significant difference before and after treatment (P0. 05). Observed in peripheral blood of patients before treatment, IL-6 was (321┬▒38) ng/ml, after treatment, IL-6 in peripheral blood was (185┬▒19) ng/ml, before and after treatment was statistically significant (P0. 05) Control group of patients before treatment was TNF-╬▒ in peripheral blood (150┬▒27) ng/ml, after treatment, TNF-╬▒ in peripheral blood was (135┬▒21) ng/ml, no significant difference before and after treatment (P0. 05). Observed in peripheral blood of patients before treatment, TNF-╬▒was (154┬▒25) ng/ml, after treatment, TNF-╬▒ in peripheral blood was (97┬▒14) ng/ml, before and after treatment was statistically significant (P0. 05) Observed compared with the control group, the former TNF-╬▒ in peripheral blood were significantly reduced. Use of conventional drug control patients before and after treatment MMSE, ADL┬áΓÇª

title: A RFID Fractional Frequency Synthesizer Based on ╬ú╬ö Modulation
abstract: In order to suppress the phase noise and overcome the deficiencies of integer frequency and fractional frequency technologies, a fractional frequency synthesizer design proposal based on ╬ú╬ö modulation was proposed, and the performance of the design proposal was emphatically analyzed. The simulation showed that the solution can effectively solve the problem of frequency spur, and effectively suppress the phase noise of the frequency synthesizer in the medium frequency offset, therefore it is expected to be widely applicable in RFID systems.

title: Research for the Key Technologies of Smart Grid Dispatching
abstract: This paper studied the key technoligies and scientific issues of the smart grid dispatching, combining the status and trends of the development of smart grid, and has done research and analysis from the four aspects respectively as follow, the security and defense of a large network and panoramic information and integrated technology platform of smart grid dispatching, the multi-level integration of security check rechnology, energy saving intelligent optimization technology and multi-dimensional intelligent visualization technology of large grid. Summarized the existing equipment and industrial in the power network dispatching and gave some suggestions for developing the technologies of smart grid dispathching.

title: The application of problem-based learning in clinical skill teaching of dermatology
abstract: Objective To investigate the essentiality and significance of applying problem-based learning (PBL) teaching method in clinical skill training of dermatology. Methods PBL teaching method was carried out for clinical skill training in out-patient departments and in wards. Results A good result was obtained by using PBL in clinical skill training, which promoted students' comprehensive skills. Conclusion PBL teaching method is conduce to changing the traditional teaching concept, and promoting the development of clinical skill training reform.

title: Image clustering based on fuzzy and dominant texture spectrum of partition
abstract: Based on the dominant color method, this paper presents a concept of dominant texture spectrum of partition. It generates threshold automatically to filter noise in each sub-block. From the perspective of fuzzy logic, a new texture spectrum descriptor is presented. It integrates the average of gray scales in areas, and constructs memberships function to calculate the value of texture units. Experimental results show the methods keep high clustering precision.

title: Statistic Analysis of Human Papilloma Virus Infection of Different Age Group of Women in Chengdu Region [J]
abstract: Objective To understand the age distribution of human papilloma virus infection and the association between high-risk subtype or multiple infection and clinical symptoms. Methods 500 patient specimens from March 2011 to December 2011 were collected and genotyped with reverse dot blot method, the results were analyzed by excel 2003 and spss13. 0 package. Results Among 500 specimens, 258 cases were positive with human papilloma virus (HPV), the infection rate was 51.6%, low-risk and high-risk positive was 130 cases and 128 cases respectively. However, among different clinical symptoms the distribution of low-risk and high-risk were very different. In general, high-risk infection rate increased with the severity of clinical symptoms. Similarly, with the increase of severity of clinical symptoms, the probability of multiple infection increased. Conclusion Through the statistic of infection of different ages, we found that 16-30 was the peak period of human papilloma virus infection, but the human papilloma virus infection rate in middle-aged and older female group was still high.

title: The Research for Low-Temperature Carbonization of Low Metamorphic Coal in Qinghai
abstract: The low metamorphic coal resources are rich in Qinghai province. In this paper, the oxygen-rich low-temperature carbonization technique is used to study the pyrolysis process of low metamorphic coal. The results show that in the pyrolysis process of low metamorphic coal, the productive rate of coke, tar, coke-oven gas is impacted by pyrolysis temperature and the component of low metamorphic coal. With the increasing pyrolysis temperature, the productive rate of coke decrease, and the productive rate of tar and coke gas increase. The activity of coke is impacted by its volatility. The higher the volatility is, the higher the activity is. The results of this study provide a theoretical basis for comprehensive and high value use of low metamorphic coal.

title: AHP method in computing factor weight of the network learning pattern recognition
abstract: The factors cluster analysis is needed in the Network learning pattern recognition (NLPR) process. In order to analysis factors more effectively and exactly, the paper proposed the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) method to ascertain the factor weights. Firstly, the paper described AHP theory and its computing procedure. Then, combined with the factors in the Network Learning System, the paper introduced the factor weights computing approach and the result. The AHP method has higher logicality and reliability which in the analysis of the factors relative importance.

title: Removal efficiency and uptake kinetics of nitrogen in water body by Salix integra
abstract: A water culture experiment was conducted to study the uptake of nitrogen (N) in simulated eutrophic water by 2 Salix integra clones ('Yizhibi'and'Weishanhu'), and the routine depletion technique was adopted to approach the uptake kinetics of NH4+-N and NO3--N by the root systems of these two clones. In low concentrations of eutrophic water, the 2 clones could effectively remove N, with the removal rate of total N being 90%, which was 2 times as that in high concentrations of eutrophic water. The 2 clones could also effectively remove phosphorous (P), with the removal rate of total P reached 80% and 92% in the low and high concentrations of eutrophic water, respectively. Compared with'Weishanhu','Yizhibi'had a higher efficiency in removing total N and total P, and the 2 clones performed better in higher concentrations of the simulated eutrophic water. Under the conditions of only existing NH4+-N or NO3--N,'Weishanhu'had greater maximum N uptake rate and N affinity than'Yizhibi'; when the other N sources existed, the NH4+-N or NO3--N uptake rate of the two clones fell down to 50%. It was concluded that these 2 clones performed well in the ecological remediation of eutrophic water, and could be chosen as the better tree species for non-point source pollution control.

title: The Study of Construction and Analysis Method of Social Network Model Based on Cooperator Relationship
abstract: As the new work mode develops, virtual collaborative environments play an increasingly important role in future business and personal activities. Our research proposes a new method of constructing collaborators social network model which considers both communication relations and cooperative relations between cooperators. This method uses public information on the work platform to discover the cooperatorΓÇÖs behaviors, discovers community relationship intensity between collaborators and uses these to construct the coordinators social network model. Finally, we use the test data from the open source community website www.codeplex.com to prove the validity of the model and the method. As a result, this method does not only improve the connectivity of social networks, but also reflects each collaboratorΓÇÖs role of team better.

title: A Novel Targeted Multi-Functional Fusion Protein Possesses Inhibitory Activities Against Bacteria, Thrombin and Platelet Aggregation
abstract: In the present study, we designed a novel targeted multi-functional fusion protein LHAD composed of LL-37, FXa recognition peptide, hirudin-12-residue, AAP, and RGD peptide. It was expressed in the Pichia pastoris GS115 strain and purified by affinity chromatography. The in vitro studies suggested that the novel designed protein exhibited antibacterial activity, anti-platelet aggregation and anti-thrombin activities. Moreover, the capability of anti-thrombin was significantly increased compared to that of natural hirudin. Our study may provide a potential approach to design multi-functional drugs for the prevention and management of thrombosis.

title: A new IVC based on Ad Hoc and its design simulations
abstract: The paper proposes a new Intervehicle Communication (IVC) System for highway driving, which integrates modern electronic technologies and advanced communications technologies. ZigBee technique is used to realize Ad Hoc communication between the vehicles and GPS is used for speed forecast and distance alarm. Least Square Method (LSM) is used to predict the vehicular location on highway and the prediction performance is improved. The MAC layer routing algorithm of Ad Hoc is simulated by NS2, different network protocols are compared and optimized at last.

title: Clinicopathologic analysis of 7 cases of primary cutaneous NK/T cell lymphoma, nasal type
abstract: [Clinicopathologic Analysis of 7 Cases of Primary Cutaneous NK/T Cell Lymphoma, Nasal Type] [Clinicopathologic Analysis of 7 Cases of Primary Cutaneous NK/T Cell Lymphoma, Nasal Type] Zhonghua Bing Li Xue Za Zhi. 2011 Nov;40(11):772-3. title: Characteristic of Climate Change and Its Impact Analysis in Estuary Wetland of Minjiang River
abstract: Four conventional stations were selected to analyze the characteristics of the climate change from 1961 to 2010 in estuary wetland of Minjiang river during the recent 50 years, as well as its impacts on the wetland. The results showed that the temperature of Minjiang river estuary wetland presented an increasing trend significantly. The precipitation of the wetland considerably fluctuated and increased, but not significantly. The regional thermal index of the wetland showed an increasing trend significantly, and the regional moisture index showed an increasing trend in the mass, but the extent of increase was lesser. Overall, the climate would tend to be warmer and wetter in Minjiang river estuary wetland, but the climate change trend was less obvious. The results provided important references for the conservation, rational exploitation and utilization of the wetland.εÇâ

title: O1-4.3 Seasonal variation in blood pressure among Chinese adults: the Kadoorie Biobank Study of 0.5 million people in China
abstract: Introduction Seasonal variation in blood pressure and its association with outdoor air temperature has been reported in several studies. However, large population-based studies are few and data from developing countries such as China are limited.Methods Cross-sectional data from the Kadoorie Biobank Study were used to relate seasonal variation in systolic blood pressure (SBP) to outdoor air temperature in 510ΓÇê000 Chinese adults aged 30ΓÇô79 recruited during 2004ΓÇô2008 at 10 widely separated study sites. Analyses related mean SBPΓÇöoverall and in subgroups of the populationΓÇöto mean local air temperature on the day of recruitment.Results SBP was strongly inversely associated with temperature within all 10 areas studied, at least above 5┬░C, with a mean rise of 5.7 (SE 0.04) mmΓÇéHg per 10┬░C fall in outdoor temperature. The mean difference in SBP between summer (JunΓÇôAug) and winter (DecΓÇôFeb) was┬áΓÇª

title: A study of hadronic shower development in the ECAL of the alpha magnetic spectrometer II
abstract: In this paper, we studied the development of hadronic shower in an electromagnetic calorimeter of Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer II. Two parametrized empirical formulae were proposed to describe the hadronic shower shape in calorimeter. Using 100 GeV proton beam incident on the center of the ECAL, detailed plots of lateral and longitudinal hadronic shower behavior were given and we found the formulae can describe the development of the hadronic shower with the test beam data. The possible application of the parametrized formulae including e┬▒-╧Ç┬▒discrimination and tau jet reconstruction was discussed.

title: Effects of a new immunodepressant J2 on lymphocytic secretion of interleukin 10 and interferon gamma in mice after corneal allograft
abstract: AbstractBACKGROUND:J2 is a new immunodepressant targeting CD4, and previous studies have verified the effect of J2 on spleen cells of normal mice or mice undergoing corneal transplantation.OBJECTIVE:To investigate the effects of J2 on the lymphocytic secretion of interferon gamma (IFN-╬│) and interle

title: Neoadjuvant chemotherapy and prognostic subgroups defined by survival benefit in patients with locoregionally advanced nasopharyngeal carcinoma.
abstract: 5536              Background: To evaluate the contribution of neoadjuvant chemotherapy for patients with locoregionally advanced nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) and to identify the prognostic subgroups that could benefit the most from neoadjuvant chemotherapy. Methods: From 2004 through 2009, 164 patients with stage II to IVb NPC were treated by radiotherapy alone (RT; n = 74) or chemoradiotherapy (RT/CT; n = 90). All patients received 68-70 Gy to the nasopharynx. Neoadjuvant chemotherapy consisted of 2-4 cycles of cisplatin and 5-fluorouracil, or cisplatin and docetaxel every 3 weeks. Both groups were well-matched for prognostic factors except cancer stage, with more advanced NPC in RT/CT. Results: With a mean follow-up of 34.5 months, the 3-year actuarial rates of overall survival (OS), disease-free survival (DFS), metastasis-free survival and relapse-free survival for RT/CT and RT alone groups┬áΓÇª

title: Discussion on the development of forestry bioenergy in east china sea areas
abstract: Recently affected both by high oil prices continue to run and environmental pollution and global climate change, the world set off a new round of biomass energy development and utilization. In China the situation that shortage of power seems getting much more serious. But it is well known that less arable land is one of China's basic national conditions. In this context shoreline and other marginal lands to cultivate energy crops for biomass energy play an important role in the field. However in the past two decades the East China Sea environment has faced huge stresses from anthropogenic activities and population growth in the Yangtze River drainage basin and the coastal areas. In order to cope with these environmental problems and provide alternative energy, planting trees is of importance and significance for improving environment and producing renewable biomass energy in the region. Moreover biomass┬áΓÇª

title: Bundling features with multiple segmentations for object-based image retrieval
abstract: In the area of objectεÇæ based image retrieval, the traditional visual words (VW) based methods neglected the spatial relationship among local features, resulting in the low accuracy. To overcome this problem, a novel method of bundling features with multiple segmentations was proposed. In our method, images were multiple segmented, and all segmentations were described by SIFT features fallen inside the area to generate bundling features. The bundling features were matched based on the VW vocabulary. An improved similarity metric was presented to measure the similarity between matched bundling features, and the degree of similarity was infused into the vector space model of VW method, to calculate the image similarity. Experiments show that the proposed method can exploit the space relationships among local features, and improve the retrieval accuracy greatly with no significant reduction in the┬áΓÇª

title: In Situ Fabrication and Properties of Mg2Si/AZ91D Magnesium Matrix Composites
abstract: Mg2Si/AZ91D magnesium matrix composites are fabricated from AZ91D-Al2 (SiO3) 3 system by direct melt reaction method. The effects of the variation Al2 (SiO3) 3 addition contents to the microstructures and mechanical properties of the composites are investigated. The results show that the amounts of Mg2Si particles are increased and the structures of AZ91D magnesium alloy are refined with the Al2 (SiO3) 3 content increasing. When the additional content of Al2 (SiO3) 3 is 3wt.%, the tensile strength of the composite reaches 178.6 MPa, which is increased by nearly 14.5% than that of AZ91D matrix alloy.

title: Effect of nitrogen on watermelon seedling growth and chlorophyll fluorescence parameters of watermelon leaves.
abstract: The sand culture was used to investigate the changes of watermelon seedlings seedlings Subject Category: Miscellaneous

title: Analysis of technological parameter for laser cutting stainless steel sheet
abstract: Based on the working principle of laser cutting, three main technological parameters are analyzed in this article, including defocusing amount, auxiliary gas pressure and cutting speed. Theoretical study of the influence mechanism is carried out. With plenty of technological experiments for confirming defocusing amount of steel sheets with different thickness, method for confirming defocusing amount is summarized. Then test of auxiliary gas pressure for steel sheets with different thickness is carried out to work out the method for confirming. Finally, cutting speed is analyzed to get theoretical method for determining the cutting speed. Analysis and research of this thesis provides reference for the application of laser cutting, which will be significant in guiding practical application.[Fund]: Θçìσ║åτÉåσ╖Ñσñºσ¡ªµ▒╜Φ╜ªΘ¢╢Θâ¿Σ╗╢σê╢ΘÇáσÅèµúÇµ╡ïµèÇµ£»µòÖΦé▓Θâ¿Θçìτé╣σ«₧Θ¬îσ«ñσ╝Çµö╛Φ»╛Θóÿσƒ║ΘçæΦ╡äσè⌐ (04-66-05);; Θçìσ║åσ╕éτºæσºöµö╗σà│Θí╣τ¢« (CSTC, 2005AC3033)

title: Analysis on new cases of pneumoconiosis in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region from 2006 to 2010 [J]
abstract: Analysis on new cases of pneumoconiosis in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region from 2006 to 2010--πÇèChina Occupational MedicineπÇï2011σ╣┤04µ£ƒ Full-Text Search∩╝Ü Home|Journal Papers|About CNKI|User Service|FAQ|Contact Us|Σ╕¡µûç πÇèChina Occupational MedicineπÇï 2011-04 Add to Favorite Get Latest Update Analysis on new cases of pneumoconiosis in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region from 2006 to 2010 LIU Li,CHEN Gui-zhi,SHI Qiu-tao πÇÉCateGory IndexπÇæ∩╝Ü R135.2 Download(CAJ format) Download(PDF format) CAJViewer7.supports all the CNKI file formats; AdobeReader only supports the PDF format. πÇÉCitationsπÇæ Chinese Journal Full-text Database 3 Hits 1 MAI Zhi-dan,LI Xiao-ping,GE Xian-min;Epidemiological study of pneumoconiosis in Guangxi in 2008[J];China Occupational Medicine;2010-05 2 LIU Ming,LI Peng-qi(Henan Institute of Occupational Disease,Zhengzhou 450052,China);Statistical analysis on ΓÇª

title: Some self-provided co-generation plant engineering occupational-disease-inductive control effect assessment
abstract: Objective Evaluation of occupational hazards a self-provided thermal control effect. Methods Through the field test for the hygienic survey, workplaces, the occupational-disease-inductive factors concentration (or intensity), analyzes its occupational-disease-inductive control effect. Results Detection of physical and chemical harmful factors 15 species, including dust detection point 40, eligible point 25, percent of pass 62.5%; Detection 11 kinds of toxic chemical, involving 36 points, detection qualified rate 100%; Noise testing involves 53 points, detection rate 86.79%; Frequency electric field and welding arc detection are 100% pass rate. Conclusion Dust and noise are the main occupational hazards in plants, and the degree of harm is very serious and should be modified by engineering technology, to take effective protective measures to control occupational hazards.

title: Detection and Evaluation of Occupational Hazards in An Aluminum Plant
abstract: [Objective] To identify, analyze and evaluate the potential occupational hazards and harmful levels of an aluminum plant, to put forward corresponding protection measures, and prevent or control occupational diseases.[Methods] Field hygienic survey and inspection and testing methods were adopted according to relevant laws, regulations and standards.[Results] The main occupational hazards in the production process of aluminum plant were alumina dust, silica dust, graphite dust, fluoride, hydrogen fluoride, carbonmonoxide, sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, noise, heat, electromagnetic radiation, etc. The fixed-point detection included 54 dust-exposed locations, among them 47 locations were qualified, with pass rate of 87%. 40 types of individual dust were tested, among them 34 Jobs were qualified, with pass rate of 85% 17 types of noise were detected, among them 13 types were within health limits, with pass rate of 76.5%. 7 kinds of toxic chemicals and heat, magnetic field, frequency electric field were detected, the results were in line with the relevant standards.[Conclusion] The measures taken to control occupational hazards can achieve the goal of protection to some extent, but some places' occupational hazards are still serious. For the existed problems, the employer should follow the appropriate laws and regulatory requirements, and combine with recommendations for corrective actions and implementation, so that the concentration (or intensity) of occupational hazards in the workplace can be within the national occupational health limits, to prevent or control occupational disease.

title: Design of test-bench for engine driven generator system based on LabWindows/CVI [J]
abstract: At present, there is still no appropriate testing platform and method for domestic engine driven generator system. In order to test the technical parameters of engine driven generator system under various operating modes accurately, a test-bench for engine driven generator system based on virtual instrument was designed. This test-bench is applicable for the test of loads under different power and voltage. To favor the test, multi-threading technology based on LabWindows/CVI was used. The test results showed that the performance of the established system was stable and can meet the power quality test requirement of engine driven generator system.

title: Multi-View 3D Retrieval Using SIFT Feature [J]
abstract: A 3D model retrieval algorithm based on multi-view scale invariant feature transform (SIFT) feature is researched. By carrying on the multi-view projection of a 3D model, the omnidirectional 2D projection depth maps are obtained, from which SIFT features are extracted. Individual-k-means and Whole-k-means are used to establish the codebook for shape benchmark respectively. Using the feature quantization codebook, all the features are clustered and generated the histogram as the 3D model feature vector. The similarity matching of 3D model is realized by calculating Kullback-Leibler (KL) divergence according to the feature vector. Experiments show that the algorithm can be adequate to both articulated shapes and rigid shapes, and gain a better retrieval effect.

title: Decolorization of azo dye reactive black 5 by Enterobacter.
abstract: Bacterium with potential to decolorize azo dyes was isolated from lab scale modified anaerobic-anoxic-aerobic (AAO) process for treating printing and dyeing wastewater. Factors affecting the decolorization decolorization Subject Category: Techniques, Methodologies and Equipment

title: Numerical Simulation of Laser Induced Ultrasound in Double Layer Materials Based on Finite Element Method
abstract: The thermoelastically generated ultrasound in double layer materials was numerically simulated by finite element method (FEM), and the stress field on top and bottom surface was obtained. Then, the frequency signal from the waveform of stress was obtained by using FFT, according to the group velocity of the ultrasonic packet so that the modes of Lamb wave in the materials could be found out. The results showed that three kinds of modes of Lamb wave influenced by the substrate were fount in aluminum plate of the double layer materials. The results could provide a new approach for the research of the laser induced ultrasound in composite material.

title: Process Optimization for the Development of a Fermented Milk Beverage of Chrysanthemum Flower Extract
abstract: Chrysanthemum flower extract and fresh bovine milk were mainly used as raw materials to develop a novel fermented beverage based on sterilization and subsequent fermentation by inoculated lactic acid bacteria. Employing orthogonal array design, the optimal fermentation medium composition was determined to consist of 20% chrysanthemum flower extract, 8% sucrose and 40% milk and meanwhile, fermentation for 4 h at 42Γäâ and an inoculum size of 3% was found optimal.

title: Biotreatment of azo dyeing wastewater using a modified anaerobic-anoxic-aerobic reactor system
abstract: Modified anaerobic-anoxic-aerobic (A 2 O) technology for dye wastewater was studied. The effects of Hydraulic retention times (HRT), sludge retention time (SRT) and carbon source on treatment efficiency were discussed. Scanning electron microscopes (SEM) for different sludge and UV-visible spectrum analysis for influent and effluent were investigated respectively. The results showed that when COD of influent was 600~ 1200 mg/L and the dye concentration was 20~ 40 mg/L, HRT had the obvious effect on treatment efficiency of modified A 2 O system. Total treatment efficiency of the improved system was more than 90% at the optimal HRT (29 h). The dye structure was demonstrated to be changed during the process. Finally, the dye and its intermediates were transformed and mineralized respectively.

title: Development and Application of Harmonic Analysis and Management Software in Power System [J]
abstract: According to the principle of a minimum investment cost of passive filter and combining the improved inherent structure of network with the harmonic flow algorithm, a harmonic analysis and management software based on Matlab and Delphi language is developed. The software, in addition to general harmonic analysis function, also has two special functions: analysis of parallel and series resonance with the improved inherent structure of network, so to keep resonance numbers of system far away from the number of harmonic sources, to avoid harmonic resonance and harmonic amplification; the optimal allocation position of each class of harmonic filter based on the inherent structure of network is determined, the ratings of filter is subject to optimal design by the use of adaptive differential evolution algorithm so to keep harmonic index of each node of the network meet as much as possible the national standard requirement and reach the purpose of suppressing harmonic distortion of each node of the power grid. In addition, graphics editor with friendly interface and powerful function and also integrated software package of the power system harmonic power flow analysis and optimization filter design are developed. It is shown through practical example of calculation and analysis that the proposed method is correct and effective and the development software is more practical.

title: Numerical Simulation on Effect of Multiple Injection on Combustion and NO_x Emission of Diesel Engine [J]
abstract: Based on KIVA-3V code, the numerical simulation on the combustion process and NOx emission of a diesel engine is carried out, using multiple injection methods. The results show that compared with the traditional single injection, pilot injection can decline the ignition delay period and the maximum combustion temperature, which lead to the reduction of the NOx emission; with too small advanced angle of the pilot injection, the NOx emission declines only a little; if the advanced angle of the pilot injection is too large, NOx emission increases. Under the condition of 11 CA advanced angle of the pilot injection, 15% pilot injection fuel mass, and 4 CA advanced angle of the main injection, the NOx emission can be reduced by about 13%.

title: Algorithm of single-phase-to-ground fault in transmission line based on the wavelet transform
abstract: The single-phase-to-ground fault is the most common fault occurred in transmission lines. Here the wavelet transform singularity detection theory is applied in the traveling wave fault detection to precisely locate the fault point in the single-phase-to-ground transmission lines. The simulation result show that the algorithm is effective.

title: Characteristics of threshold shear strain of saturated Nanjing fine sand under complex stress condition
abstract: Using GDS dynamic hollow cylinder torsion apparatus (HCA), a series of cyclic torsional triaxial tests under complex initial consolidation condition were performed on saturated Nanjing fine sand while Dr= 50%. The effect of the initial principal stress direction (╬▒0), the initial ratio of deviatoric stress (╬╖0), the initial average effictive principal stress (p0), and the initial intermediate principal stress parameter (b0) on the threshold shear strain (╬│t) of saturated Nanjing fine sand were systematically studied. The results show that ╬│t increases with the increase of ╬╖0, p0, and b0 when the other three parameters keep constant. ╬▒0 have a great influence on reducing ╬│t, when ╬▒0 increases from 0 to 45; ╬│t increased, when ╬▒0 increases from 45 to 90. The effect of ╬▒0 on ╬│t play a leading role and the effect of ╬╖0 is weakened while ╬▒0 about 45.
