title: Study on the application of laser-peening technique for nuclear power equipment
abstract: [en] Stress corrosion and fatigue failure are very dangerous factors concerned with the safe and stable operation of nuclear power plant. It is an effective means to ensure the safe and stable operation of nuclear power plant by releasing or erasing the stress corrosion or fatigue failure. By use of laser-peening technique, which reduce stress corrosion or fatigue failure effectually without residue, and can be remotely controlled in a narrow and complex radiated area of nuclear island. So it is a technique with bright future and worth study deeply.(authors)

title: Overall Design of Shengli Bridge in Tongliao City [J]
abstract: A 3├ù 81.44 m simply-supported concrete-filled steel tube tied arch is designed for the main bridge of Shengli Bridge in Tongliao City, and the rise-to-span ratio of the arch is f/L= 1/5. The substructure incorporates a structural form of group piles plus pile caps. The arch ribs are two deck arch ribs of vertical dumbbell shape. To ensure the spatial stability of the tied arch, three wind bracings are arranged between the two arch ribs. 17 pairs of suspenders are installed for each span of the arch bridge, a suspender is composed of 85 galvanized high strength steel wires each of 7 mm in diameter, and the suspenders are large torque finished cables with double protective layers produced in factory. The tied beams are set between the bicycle and footway lanes and the cross section of the beams is the box section. Each span of the arch bridge has 17 middle cross beams and two end cross beams, of which the middle cross beams are prestressed concrete (PC) T-beams while the end cross beams are cast-in-situ two cell single box concrete beams. The floor system is formed of PC cross beams, reinforced concrete longitudinal stiffening beams and trough slabs. The static and stability analyses of the overall bridge indicate that the design meets the code requirements. The construction scheme of" erecting beam first and arch late" is adopted for the bridge, and the operation condition of the bridge is so far so good after completion of the construction.

title: Analysis on Flaws of Dissimilar Steel Weld Joints for 12Cr1MoV and TP304H
abstract: The flaws of dissimilar steel weld joints for 12Cr1MoV and TP304H were investigated by macroscopic observation, and examinations of metallurgical microscope and mechanical properties at room temperature. The results demonstrated that the cuneiform extension and enriched carbon layers around the melting line was the reason for cracking; and the creep damage resulted in the extension of cracking to 12Cr1MoV.

title: Simultaneous Determination of Clenbuterol, Chloramphenicol and Diethylstilbestrol in Bovine Milk by Isotope Dilution Ultra Performance Liquid Chromatography-Tandem Mass┬áΓÇª
abstract: A method for the determination of clenbuterol, chloramphenicol and diethylstilbestrol in bovine milk was developed by isotope dilution ultra high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry. Samples were directly purified through HLB cartridge with 5 mL water and 5 mL hexane as washing solution. The analytes were eluted with 15 mL ethyl acetate. Then the eluate was evaporated to dryness at 40Γäâ under nitrogen and redissolved with 5 mmol┬╖ L-1 of ammonium acetate solution-acetonitrile (90Γê╢ 10, by volume). The analytes were analyzed by LC-MS/MS on an Acquity UPLCεÅ½ BEH C18 column using acetonitrile-5 mmol┬╖ L-1 ammonium acetate as mobile phase by gradient elution. The mass spectrometer was operated under multiple reaction monitoring (MRM) mode. The samples were quantified by the internal standards labeled with stable isotopes. The calibration curves of clenbuterol, chloramphenicol and diethylstilbestrol were linear in the ranges of 0.2-20, 1.2-100, 2.0-200 ╬╝g┬╖ L-1, respectively, with correlation coefficients more than 0.998 5. The limits of detection of clenbuterol, chloramphenicol and diethylstilbestrol were 0.009, 0.007, 0.04 ng┬╖ g-1, respectively. The recoveries of three drugs in bovine milk sample at the fortified levels of 0.05-0.10 (clenbuterol), 0.30-0.60 (chloramphenicol), 0.50-1.0 ng┬╖ g-1 (diethylstilbestrol) were in the range of 94%-107% with RSDs less than 10%. The method was suitable for the determination of clenbuterol, chloramphenicol and diethylstibestrol residues in bovine milk.

title: A noise reduction algorithm of hyperspectral imagery using double-regularizing terms total variation
abstract: In the present paper, an effective total variation denoising algorithm is proposed based on hyperspectral imagery noise characteristics. The new algorithm generalizes the classical total variation denoising algorithm for two-dimensional images to a three-dimensional formulation. Considering the fact that the noise of hyperspectral imagery shows different characteristics in spatial domain and spectral domain respectively, the objective function of the proposed total variation algorithm is improved by utilizing double-regularizing terms (spatial term and spectral term) and separate regularization parameters respectively. Then, the new objective function is discretized via approximating the gradient of the regularizing terms by three orthogonal local differences, and further majorized by a convex quadratic function. Thus, noise in spatial and spectral domain could be removed independently by minimizing the majorizing┬áΓÇª

title: Analysis of Sleep Disorder in Elderly Stroke Patients and Care Behavioral Intervention [J]
abstract: Objective: To investigate the cause of sleep disorder in elderly stroke patients and the related care behavioral intervention. Methods: The clinic data of 54 elderly stroke patients with sleep disorder were analyzed. Results: The causes of sleep disorder in elderly stroke patients were relative to disease, environment, psychological status, social factor, improper life style and so on. The sleep quality of the elderly stroke patients was improved by the care intervention. Conclusions: The care intervention of sleeping behavior can improve the sleep quality of the elderly stroke patients.

title: Analysis of Gas Dynamics in a Rotating Disk Cavity
abstract: A fundamental study has been performed to analysis the fluid dynamic characteristics of the gas medium in a rotating disk cavity through the commercial software CFX11. 0. This paper aims to discuss the impact of the speed of rotating disk, axial and radial size and parietal lubricant film velocity and other factors on the gas flow state in cavity. Several conclusions have been obtained: the speed of rotating disk has a great impact on velocity distribution of gas flow field; the dimensionless tangential velocity of the gas medium decreases along the radial direction, and with the speed increasing, it shows a certain regularity; Dimensionless radial velocity decreases along the radial direction, and the speed of rotating disk nearly has no influence on this; The shear stress distribution along the radial direction and the distribution of tangential velocity have similar regularity; the impact of disk cavity height on the distribution of┬áΓÇª

title: Direct manipulation of 3D mesh deformation
abstract: We present an efficient and fast algorithm for 3D mesh deformation in this paper. By edge collapse mesh simplification, our algorithm simplifies the original shape to a reduced mesh, which contains the salient feature of the original 3D shape. For the reduced mesh, we specify an affine transformation for each vertex called key point. According to the user's manipulation, the fixed or moved constraints are imposed on some key points. Using a nonlinear optimization, the transformation matrixes of all the key points are solved. Then, for the original shape, all the vertexes can be mapped, based on the affine transformation of key points, to the new position to realize 3D shape deformation. Our algorithm resolves the transformation matrix of the key points instead that of all the vertexes of original shape, such that it can retrench the computational cost and realize real-time display, while gain the detail preserved 3D deformation.

title: Multidrug resistance of tumor/progenitor stem cells--review
abstract: Tumor Stem/Progenitor Cells are characterized by undifferentiation/hypodifferention, self-renewal, differentiation potential, which is responsible for tumor occurrence, growth and metastasis. The theory about tumor stem/progenitor cells provides a new insight to recognize the origin and essence of tumors. Gaining a better insight into the origin of tumor stem/progenitor cells and the mechanisms of tumor stem/progenitor cells resistance to chemotherapy may lead to new therapeutic targets and better anticancer strategies. This review summarizes recent progress of research on the origin of tumor stem/progenitor cells and multidrug resistance.

title: TrigSigs: an effective record linkage algorithm for unstructured data
abstract: A novel clustering algorithm named TrigSigs was proposed to overcome the problem of record linkage models for unstructured data from network. It focuses on mining the associations of hidden attributes as the signatures of objects in unstructured data by trigger-pair model. It can group tokens which help identify objects and filter out noise. Then it assigns weight to tokens properly which makes feature vectors more representative for identifying objects. After these steps, it gains fine-grained object-based clustering result from unstructured data. Experiments on real datasets show that this algorithm can filter out most noise and assign weight for features properly, and improves the clustering results greatly.

title: Prognosis comparison in middle and later stage severe hepatitis B patients treat with plasma exchange or unified medicine therapy
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To observe the influence on the prognosis of the patients with severe hepatitis B in middle and later stage treated with plasma exchange or unified medicine therapy, and search the therapy methods on the middle and later stage severe hepatitis B. METHODS: To observe the liver function, complications and prognosis of the patients treated with plasma exchange on the basis of unified medicine therapy. To compare with that of the corresponding period patients with unified medicine therapy and analysis the clinical data with statistics methods. RESULTS: 36 cases of the plasma exchange group, 18 cases survived and 18 cases died. 32 cases of the unified medicine therapy group, 13 cases survived and 19 cases died. The survival rates between the two groups patients does not appear statistics difference; liver function index (ALT, AST, SB, ALB, TC, ChE) and PT also appear the same results in statistics. CONCLUSIONS: Compare with unified medicine therapy, plasma exchange on the basis of the unified medicine therapy does not appear to improve survival rate of the patients with the middle and later stage severe hepatitis B. The prognosis of these patients determined by the liver failure extent itself.

title: Improving grid performance by dynamically deploying applications
abstract: Grid applications are normally deployed on computing nodes beforehand, which may cause the undesirable situation that some of these nodes (with hot applications deployed) are always busy whereas the others are consistently idle. Therefore, the overall performance (e.g. throughput and load balancing) of such a Grid system would be seriously degraded. In this paper, we present the idea of Hierarchical and Dynamic Deployment of Application (HDDA) in Grid to improve the system performance. With HDDA, an application can be dynamically deployed and undeployed when necessary. In order to reduce the overhead caused by HDDA, the Average Latency Ratio Minimum (ALRΓÇÉMIN) replacement strategy is also proposed. It deploys applications to nodes with minimum ALR of Node (NALR), and evicts applications with minimum increment of ALR. The results of the experiment we conducted on ChinaGrid show┬áΓÇª

title: Effective Defense System Based on the Classical Attack in the OLSR Routing Protocol
abstract: This paper analyzes the weakness of the OLSR protocol in the Self Organized Network and introduces some attacks that the protocol may suffer. A corresponding defensive scheme in combination with the reactive PKI and a trust model is presented and the mechanism to resist attacks is introduced. Finally, we use the NS2 to simulate the procedure of the defensive mechanism and discuss the feasibility of the scheme.

title: Apparatus and method for increasing the concentration of recycled hydrogen in a high pressure hydrogenation reactor
abstract: An apparatus and a method that increase the concentration of recycled hydrogen in the hydrogenation unit are disclosed having a hydration separation unit included between the high-pressure separator and hydrocracking reactor. A part of the recycled hydrogen contacts with the water-in-oil microemulsion to form hydrates from which the light hydrocarbon components are removed. The gas flow entering into the hydration separation unit is present in amount of 20% 100% of the total gas flow coming from the high-pressure separator; the water-in-oil microemulsion, in which the volume ratio of oil and water is 1: 1 to 5: 1 may increase hydrogen partial pressure in the reactor and thus upgrade the performance of hydrogenation.

title: Construction of recombinant adenovirus containing TK gene and its effect against human liver cancer cells
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To construct a replication-defective adenovirus containing TK gene and investigate the killing effects of TK gene against human liver cancer cells SMMC-7721. METHODS: The recombinant adenovirus ADV-TK was constructed using homologous recombination in the cells. SMMC-7721 cells transfected with recombined adenovirus were exposed to GCV, and the cell viability was measured by MTT assays. RESULTS: The recombinant adenovirus containing TK gene was successfully constructed. Transfection by the recombinant adenovirus ADV-TK and GCV exposure significantly suppressed the growth of SMMC-7721 cells. CONCLUSION: A replication-defective adenovirus containing TK gene has been successfully constructed, and in combination with GCV, the recombinant adenovirus produces significant killing effect against SMMC-7721 cells in vitro.

title: Investigation of breaking wave Action on vertical breakwater
abstract: This paper investigates the breaking wave action on vertical breakwater mounted on a moderate-crested foundation bed by both physical model tests and numerical simulations. The numerical results were compared with that of physical model test, which validate the present numerical model. The characteristics of time series of breaking wave pressure as well as the relationship between the pressure and the variations of flow fields are analyzed.

title: Effect of Temperature on Friction and Wear Behaviors of Carbon/Copper with and without Electric CurrentεÇâ
abstract: Through a series of experimental tests on a pin-on-disc tester, the tribology behavior of carbon/copper pair with and without electric current was verified. The results indicate that the temperature of frictional couple rises continuously in the process of friction and wear, and the wear valume of sliding strip increases with increasing of temperature. And the temperature of the frictional couple with electric current is higher than that without electric current. Without electric current, the friction coefficient firstly increases and then decreases with increasing of the temperature. With electric current, the friction coefficient decreases gradually with increasing of the temperature. Through observing the surface topography of the carbon sliding strip before and after wear, it is found that the wear surface becomes smoother and smoother with increasing of the temperature. Abrasive and adhesive wear dominate during no electric current┬áΓÇª

title: Dissociation behavior of (CH4 + C2H4) hydrate in the presence of sodium dodecyl sulfate
abstract: Separation of a mixture of CH4+C2H4 gas by forming hydrate in ethylene production has become of interest, and the dissociation behavior of (CH4+C2H4) hydrate is of great importance for this process. The hydrate formation rate could be increased by adding a small amount of sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS) into water. In this work, the kinetic data of CH4(18.5 mol%)+C2H4(81.5 mol%) hydrate decomposition in the presence of 1000 mg┬╖LΓêÆ1 SDS at different temperatures and pressures were measured with the depressurizing method using a sapphire cell apparatus. The experimental results show that the dissociation rate of (CH4+C2H4) mixed gas hydrate was large at high temperature and low pressure, and temperature had great influence on the dissociation rate at high pressure. A kinetic model for hydrate dissociation was proposed and the calculated results from the kinetic model were in good┬áΓÇª

title: Establishment of murine allogeneic umbilical cord blood cell transplantation model and study on the mechanism of keratinocyte growth factor enhancing immune reconstitution┬áΓÇª
abstract: To explore the impact and mechanism of keratinocyte growth factor (KGF) on immune reconstitution post murine allogeneic umbilical cord blood transplantation (UCBT). Perpheral blood (PB) from 19.5-day embryos post-conception (E 19.5 d) mice was used as umbilical cord blood (UCB) graft. Thirty-two BALB/c mice were randomly assigned to 4 groups with 8 mice each in the first cohort UCBT. Mice were infused with PBS (control group) or 1 x 10 (6)(group 1A), 2 x 10 (6)(group 1B), 3 x 10 (6) UCB mononuclear cells (MNCs)(group 1C), respectively. Twenty-four BALB/c mice were randomly assigned to 3 groups with 8 mice each in the second cohort UCBT. Mice were injected with 1 x 10 (6)(group 2A), 2 x 10 (6)(group 1B) or 3 x 10 (6)(UCB) MNCs (group 2C). All mice received platelet transfusion on+ 8d. Sixteen BALB/c mice were randomly assigned to 2 groups with 8 mice each in the third cohort UCBT. Mice were injected sc with KGF (group 3) or PBS (control group) before TBI. All mice were injected with 2 x 10 (6) UCB MNCs and were supported with platelet transfusion on+ 8 d. The survival time, splenic lymphoid cell subsets, sjTREC assay were observed after UCBT. The 100-day survival of mice were 2, 3 and 3 in group 1A, 1B, 1C and 7, 8, 8 in group 2A, 2B, 2C, respectively. The splenic T, NKT, NK and B cell counts on+ 35 d were (9.57+/-0.74) x 10 (6),(0.64+/-0.06) x 10 (6),(1.43+/-0.10) x 10 (6) and (19.13+/-1.50) x 10 (6) in control group, respectively; while were (13.47+/-0.74) x 10 (6),(0.89+/-0.03) x 10 (6),(1.79+/-0.04) x 10 (6) and (20.50+/-0.91) x 10 (6) in group 3, respectively, being significantly higher than in control group. The sjTREC┬áΓÇª

title: The epidemiological survey of paragonimiasis during the third phase of water storage in Three Gorges Dam area.
abstract: Aim: To understand the impact of construction of the Three Gorges Dam and the water storage project on paragonimiasis paragonimiasis Subject Category: Diseases, Disorders, and Symptoms

title: Experimental Research on the Treatment of Diabetic Nephropathy with Tangshen Γàá Recipe
abstract: Objective: To observe the effect of TangshenΓàáRecipe (TS) decoction on the early stage diabetic nephropathy (DN) rats. Methods: Through injecting the rats were had unilateral nephrectomy streptozocin (STZ) to set up models. The rats were randomly divided into sham-operation group (SO) Model group (M), Tangshen group (TS), B enazeprill group (B), n= 10. Animals were sacrificed after 8 weeks, the samples of urine and blood were collected at 12 hours after the final administration. The rats were observed diet and drinking, body weight, index of kidney hypertrophy (kidney weight/body weight), GLU, Scr BUN and so on. Results: The commonly, kindey weight, index of kidney hypertrophy, blood glucose and Scr BUN distinctly decreased compared with the model group (P0. 01). Conclusion: TangshenΓàáRecipe has certain renal protective effect on the early stage diabetic nephropathy rats.

title: Detection of human papillomavirus DNA by real-time PCR in cervical carcinoma screening.
abstract: In this study, HPV-DNA real-time PCR was used to detect human papillomaviruses human papillomaviruses Subject Category: Organism Groups

title: Study on the preparation of cycloicaritin liposomes and their physic-chemical properties
abstract: Objective To investigate the preparation of cycloicaritin liposomes (CIT-LPS), and their physic-chemical properties. Methods A modified infusion method was applied to prepare CIT-LPS. Taking entrapment rate as the main index, the formula was optimized through L18 (37) orthogonal design. The mean diameter and Zeta electric potential were determined by laser, the entrapment rate was measured by sephadex column chromatography, and the release degree was analyzed by reverse dialysis. Results The optimal formula of CIT-LPS was as follows: 200 mg soybean lecithin, 50 mg cholesterol, 10 mg drug, 0.1 g/L emulsifier P-188, 10 mL dichloromethane, and 20 mL PBS. Under these conditions, the entrapment rate was (89.49┬▒2.36)%, the mean diameter was (148.1┬▒13.6) nm, the polydisperse coefficient was (0.292┬▒0.062), Zeta electric potential was-(55.2┬▒4.3) mV, the release degree of 72 hours in PBS with 30% methanol was over 80%, and the release curve was in accordance with Higuchi equation. Conclusion It was feasible and reproducible to prepare CIT-LPS through modified infusion method, with a high entrapment rate, and good slow-release performance.

title: A Research on Minorities Sports Tourism Development in Hainan Province [J]
abstract: Li and Miao minority in Hainan province has a huge potential to develop with their remarkable characteristic. This paper discussed the status quo of the development of minorities sports tourism resources, the tourism product and development strategy by literature data method, expert interview and on-site investigation. The charactristic and rules of minorities sports tourism development were illustrated, the stategy, planning and measure were put forward to provide reference for development of folk sports tourism market, tourism economy and building of international tourism island of Hainan province.

title: Microstructures of TC4 Alloy Weld Joints by Electronic Beam Welding [J]
abstract: The microstructures of TC4 weld beads by electronic beam welding (EBW) with different welding parameters were studied. The results show that the shapes of weld bead are different with the change of the weld parameters, but the phases in weld seam are almost the same. The microstructure gradient in weld seam is dependent on the shape of the weld bead. The larger the angle of seam is, the larger of the size gradient of martensite gets. The micro-hardness in weld bead is HV30-50 than that of the base material. The micro-hardness in the different shape of weld beads is consistent with the microstructures gradient in the weld bead.

title: The order characteristics of fine root morphology and fine root res-piration of Ligustrum lucidum and Euscaphis japonica
abstract: With 1 year old Ligustrum lucidum and Euscaphis japonicaΓÇ▓ s entire plant as test objects in Wanmulin, JianΓÇ▓ ou, Fujian, through measuring morphological characteristics and fine rootΓÇ▓ s respiration of first to fourth order roots of plantsΓÇ▓ entire root system, the results showed that: 1) with ascending root orders, Ligustrum lucidum and Euscaphis japonicaΓÇ▓ s mean fine root diameter and mean individual root weight increased significantly (P0. 01), and so is mean root length (P0. 05, P0. 01), while specific root length (SRL) and root quantity decreased significantly (P0. 01), in which the first order roots were the thinnest in diameter, the lightest in mean individual root weight, the shortest in root length, the longest in SRL and the more in quantity. but the fourth order roots were in reverse. The morphological characteristics index in two plants between low-lever root (first order root, second order root) and advanced root (third order root, fourth order root) have difference significantly. 2) With root order increased, two speciesΓÇ▓ N content and C/N decreased significantly (P0. 01), Ligustrum lucidumΓÇ▓ s C content increased significantly (P0. 01), but Euscaphis japonicaΓÇ▓ s have no significant effects (P0. 05). 3) Ligustrum lucidum and Euscaphis japonicaΓÇ▓ s specific root respiration decreased significant with ascending root order (P0. 01), and the morphological characteristics had effect on their specific root respiration.

title: Virtual prototype simulating of four-bar beating-up mechanism of loom with joint clearance [J]
abstract: This study intends to research the influence of the joint clearance in connecting rod bin on beating-up motion. Based on the principle that the force in the bearing clearance is negative or zero means the pairing elements separate, the contact and collision in the bearing of the connecting rod bin is predicted. The kinetic pair with clearance is established by a continuous contact model, and the clearance between components is replaced by a rigid bar without mass. Virtual prototype model is established in Solidworks, and the kinematics and dynamics simulation is applied on it with COSMOSMotion. By analyzing the magnitude and direction of force loading on the clearance-bar, it is persuadable that the elements of the pair will separate and contact several times in a period of crankΓÇ▓ s movement. Based on the kinetic analysis of the slay, it is noted that the components are affected by impact force under high speed conditions, which brings negative effect on the mechanismΓÇ▓ s beating-up performance and fabricΓÇ▓ s quality.

title: Expression and significance of anti-oncogene FHIT and PTEN in primary hepatocellular carcinoma [J]
abstract: Objective: To investigate the expression and significance of FHIT and PTEN in hepatocellular liver cancer (HCC). Methods: The expressions of FHIT and PTEN in 44 cases of HCC and 10 cases of normal liver tissues were detected by immunohistochemical Envision two-step method. Results: The negative expression rate of FHIT and PTEN were 38.6%(17/44) and 47.7%(21/44) respectively in 44 cases of HCC tissues and 0 in 10 cases of normal liver tissues, expression of each anti-oncogene showed significant difference between HCC tissues and normal liver tissues (P0. 05). The negative expression rate of FHIT in HCC was significantly associated with pathological grade, TNM stage and tumor diameter (P0. 05), but was not associated with AFP level, HBsAg (+) or integral capsule (P0. 05). The negative expression rate of PTEN was significantly associated with pathological grade (P0. 05), but was not associated with TNM stage, AFP level, HBsAg (+) or integral capsule (P0. 05). The negative expression of FHIT was positively correlated with the negative expression of PTEN in HCC (rs= 0.427, P0. 01). The difference was significant between the positive and negative expression of FHIT and PTEN and the survival rates of postoperative 1 year and 3 years. Conclusion: The results demonstrate that the abnormal expression of FHIT and PTEN may be correlated with the development and progression of HCC, and there is a synergistic action between the expression of FHIT and PTEN. FHIT may be used as an important marker of malignant degree, invasion capability and poor prognosis of HCC; PTEN may be used as an important marker of malignant┬áΓÇª

title: Microstructures and Mechanical Properties of the T92/TP347H Dissimilar Steel Welded Joints [J]
abstract: T92/TP347H dissimilar steel joints were welded through the GTAW techlonogy, using two type of Ni-based welding wires ERNiCr-3 and ERNiCrMo-3. Microstructures and mechanical properties of the T92/TP347H dissimilar steel welded joints were studied. Effects of the post-weld heat-treatment on the microstructures and mechanical properties of the joints were also investigated. The results show that in the T92/TP347H dissimilar steel welded joints, the T92 heat effected zone (HAZ) mainly consists of the superheated zone, coarse grain zone and fine grain zone. The grain growth of the HAZ of TP347H is not found, nevertheless, the cabrides precipitating along the grain boundaries and inside the grains was detected. Tensile fracture of the joints always takes place in the base metal of TP347H for these two Ni-based welded joints, it indicates the higher tensile strength from two welding seams. Moreover, the ERNiCrMo-3 welded joints are of higher tensile strength, lower plasticities and inpact toughnesses, comparing with the ERNiCr-3 welded ones. The post-weld heat-treatment can improve the comprehensive mechanical properties of these two T92/TP347H dissimilar steel welded joints through reducing the handness value of the T92 HAZ.

title: Estimation of velocities of tissue motion and blood flow based on radio frequency signal deconvolution [J]
abstract: A novel approach based on radio frequency signal deconvolution is developed to estimating the velocities of blood flow and tissue motion without MTI filtering. In this method, the sampled sequences of the radio frequency echoes are transformed to the frequency domain by FFT algorithm firstly. Then these transformed sequences are deconvolved. Finally the velocities of the blood flow and the tissue motion can be obtained by a spectrum analysis of these deconvolved sequences. This approach has been applied to the simulated ultrasound echoes with two typical time-delay parameter sets. The validity of this method is examined by the comparison between the estimated velocities of blood and tissue motion and the given values. This approach is helpful to the measurement of the low-velocity blood flows.

title: In vitro bacteriostatic activity of five Chinese herbal medicines against two common pathogens of Scylla serrata.
abstract: Objective: To investigate the in vitro bacteriostatic activity of Chinese herbal medicines (rhubarb, Baikal skullcap root, honeysuckle, eucommia eucommia Subject Category: Organism Names

title: Research on Two Functions Device of Active Power Filter and Energy-feedback
abstract: The paper researches the energy-feedback device which has double functions: active power filters and energyfeedback. The energy is return to the power-grid through the device when it works at the state of regeneration energy. The device works at the state of active power filters for improve the value in use when it do not work at the state of regeneration energy. Taking paralleled active power filter as investigated subject, it makes systematic study for topology, detection algorithm of compensation reference, control strategies of the APF. Simulation results by Matlab are given to show that the device has more exact compensation effectiveness and rapidly dynamic response.

title: A Peer to Peer Large Data Parallel Computing System and its Application in High-Resolution Video Processing
abstract: Motivated by the requirement of processing large datahigh-resolution videos, a research on peer to peer (P2P) large data parallel computing is made. The proposed P2P system is unstructured, completely self-organized and load balanced, which make it very efficient in computing any kinds of dividable large data tasks. The system models and algorithms are described, and simulation results show that the proposed system has better performance than an existing grid system.

title: A wavelet and least square filter based spatial-spectral denoising approach of hyperspectral imagery
abstract: Noise reduction is a crucial step in hyperspectral imagery pre-processing. Based on sensor characteristics, the noise of hyperspectral imagery represents in both spatial and spectral domain. However, most prevailing denosing techniques process the imagery in only one specific domain, which have not utilized multi-domain nature of hyperspectral imagery. In this paper, a new spatial-spectral noise reduction algorithm is proposed, which is based on wavelet analysis and least squares filtering techniques. First, in the spatial domain, a new stationary wavelet shrinking algorithm with improved threshold function is utilized to adjust the noise level band-by-band. This new algorithm uses BayesShrink for threshold estimation, and amends the traditional soft-threshold function by adding shape tuning parameters. Comparing with soft or hard threshold function, the improved one, which is first-order derivable and has a┬áΓÇª

title: Menthyl 2-oxo-2H-chromene-3-carboxylate
abstract: The title compound, C20H24O4, was synthesized from the reaction of 2-oxo-2H-chromene-3-acyl chloride and menthol. The mean plane of the ester group and that of the four essentially planar (maximum deviation 0.0112ΓÇà├à) C atoms of the chair-form cyclohexyl ring form dihedral angles of 43.8ΓÇà(3) ┬░ and 81.8ΓÇà(1)┬░, respectively, with the mean plane of the coumarin ring system. In the crystal structure, weak intermolecular CΓÇöHΓï»O hydrogen bonds connect the molecules into a two-dimensional network.

title: Effects of emodin on expression of cytokines induced by lipopolysaccharide in corneal fibroblasts
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To investigate the effects of emodin on expression of cytokines induced by lipopolysaccharide (LPS) in cultured human corneal fibroblasts in vitro. METHODS: Primary human corneal fibroblasts of passages 4 were used in this research. Cells were treated with 10 microg/L LPS for 1, 2, 4, or 8 hours, which were pretreated with or without emodin for 30 minutes before LPS challenge. The degeneration of inhibitor of kappaB-alpha (I kappaB-alpha) and the effect of emodin on it were analyzed by Western blot analysis with a specific antibody. The cellular abundance of the mRNA of interleukin (IL)-6 and IL-8 from corneal fibroblasts under different conditions was determined by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR). RESULTS: Compared with cells without LPS treatment, I kappaB-alpha level significantly decreased in every time point after LPS challenge (P< 0.01). Emodin inhibited the LPS-induced degeneration of I kappaB-alpha by corneal fibroblasts in a dose-dependent manner (P< 0.05). Compared with cells without LPS treatment, the expressions of IL-6 and IL-8 mRNA significantly increased in every time point after LPS challenge (P< 0.01). At the same time, the expressions of the mRNA of IL-6 and IL-8 induced by LPS in corneal fibroblasts were also inhibited by emodin in a dose-dependent manner (P< 0.05). CONCLUSION: Emodin can inhibit the expressions of IL-6 and IL-8 mRNA induced by LPS in corneal fibroblasts, which maybe via inhibiting the degeneration of I kappaB-alpha and suppressing the activation of nuclear factor-kappaB.

title: Using an improved site-directed mutagenesis for the creation of constructs to analyse gene function in Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. cubense
abstract: Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. cubense (Foc) is the causal pathogen of Fusarium wilt in banana. Apart from plant resistance, no sustainable solution has been found to control Fusarium wilt. Understanding the genetic basis of pathogenesis in Foc might contribute to developing novel strategies to control Fusarium wilt. We used an improved site-directed mutagenesis to create constructs to analyse gene function in Foc. For the general site-directed mutagenesis, sequencing is the only choice to confirm the mutant clone; however in our protocol, named OE-PCR-S1, we not only improved the efficiency with Dpn I, but also used mismatch cleavage by S1 nuclease to replace sequencing to screen the mutants, which made the protocol more rapid and labour efficient and less expensive. We have used it for Foc, and have successfully deleted three bases from a pathogenic gene, FOW1 (EU795421). The mutant DNA can be┬áΓÇª

title: Analysis of Utilization of FDI in the Yangtze River Delta
abstract: Since 1990s, FDI are booming in china gradually and become essential impetus in the development of worldΓÇÖs economy and economy in developing countries especially. The Yangtze River Delta is an important region for foreign direct investment, including two provinces and shanghai city. FDI contributes a lot to the economic development in Yangtze River Delta. However, there exist many problems, for example, uneven development and scales of FDI in different cities, imbalanced development in three industries etc. In this paper, I analyze the problems and come up with resolutions to improve the FDI environment and its utilization for more economic boost to this region and China as a whole.

title: Grid Scheduling Based on Prediction of Task Completion Time
abstract: Scheduling problems of grid research area are paid more and more attention recently. In this paper, a grid Scheduling model based on prediction of task completion time (SPCT) is proposed. Through Using Least Squares Discrete Curve Fitting, SPCT dynamically establishes the regression function of Completion time of task (CTT) according to the historical record first. Predicted completion time of each coming task is calculated for each candidate node with the regression function secondly. And then, the node with the least value will be allocated to run the task. The SPCT is used to input data sensitive applications and implemented in one real-world grid environment, Bioinformatics Grid Platform. Experimental result shows that the SPCT could reduce the average CTT of tasks by 19%.

title: A new method of designing genechip probe for frontier port detection of pathogenic microorganism
abstract: In the process of designing genechip probe for detecting pathogenic microorganism, the selection of single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) combination is of great importance. At present, there is no automatic design method. This work is hard and the result is not always well. A new approach for selecting SNP combination is presented in this paper. Genetic algorithm is used to search optimal solution on the basis of classification ability of SNP combination, which is evaluated by the rough set theory. Other related experimental parameters are also incorporated. Experimental results show that the method can find out the best SNP combination pattern efficiently and accurately, thus demonstrating the reliability of this new method for designing the genechip probe.

title: City Underground Pipelines Data Check-up Based on Knowledge and Rules
abstract: Knowledge database of city underground pipelines is built by analyzing the pipelines' data structures and features in depth. An example is given to show how the rules are coded. The quality and efficiency of data supervision of Underground pipelines is greatly improved by using expert system based on the rules of the knowl-edge database.

title: Research of an active islanding detection based on slight asymmetry modulation
abstract: In the paper an active islanding detection algorithm is proposed based on grid-connected distributed generation system. If the modulation sinusoidal waveform of the DSP controller presents has been a slight asymmetry, the output current of the inverter would reveal the same amount of asymmetry, then the output power will be keep an orderly change between two consecutive half-cycle. When in grid-connected scenario, the change of output power is insignificant; however, once the islanding event takes place, the frequency of PCC(the point of common coupling) will change own to the change of output power, an appropriate use of this change of frequency can be a useful indicator for the identification of islanding. The experimental results demonstrate effectiveness and easily realized of the proposed algorithm on photovoltaic grid-connected generation system.

title: Study on islanding detection of grid-connected distributed generations with random properties
abstract: With the development of renewable energy, distributed generations such as photovoltaic generation, wind power systems need to be connected to a utility power grid for the systems to work effectively as energy sources. Islanding detection is one of the most important techniques to develop for the distributed generation systems. A novel active islanding detection algorithm based in pseudo-random signal is proposed in this paper. The modulation waveform will be modified by a binary pseudo-random signal (M-sequence signal), then the voltage of PCC (the point of common coupling) would have random properties. When in grid-connected scenario, the voltage of PCC is dominated by voltage of power grid and the variance has no remarkable peak; however, once the islanding event takes place, the variance of PCC has a remarkable peak. Therefore the islanding can be detected by monitoring a peak of the┬áΓÇª

title: Relationship between gene polymorphism of CYP2E1, CYP1A1, IL-4 and medicamentosa-like dermatitis induced by trichloroethylene
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To investigate the relationship between gene polymorphism of CYP2E1, CYP1A1, IL-4 and susceptibility of medicamentosa-like dermatitis induced by trichloroethylene (TCE). METHODS: 35 patients with medicamentosa-like dermatitis induced by TCE were chosen as the patient group, and 35 healthy workers as control group. The real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) with TaqMan minor groove binding (MGB) probes was used to test single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNP) of CYP2E1, CYP1A1 and IL-4 in the patients with medicamentosa-like dermatitis as well as in the control. The genotypes and the frequency of genotype or allele were compared between the patients and control with statistical analysis. RESULTS: The frequency of allele G within CYP1A1 gene (rs1048943) was significantly higher in TCE patients (37.1%) than that in control (P< 0.05); the frequency of allele T within CYP2E1-1053 C/T was significantly higher in TCE patients (41.4%) than that in control (P< 0.01); the frequency of T/T within IL-4-588 C/T (rs2243250) was significantly higher in TCE patients (75.0%) than that in control (P< 0.01), and the frequency of allele T within IL-4-588 C/T (rs2243250) was also significantly higher in TCE patients (87.5%) than that in control (P< 0.01). CONCLUSION: The gene polymorphism of CYP2E1, CYP1A1, IL-4 is probably associated with hypersensitivity for the TCE patients with medicamentosa-like dermatitis, and could be one of the genetic factors related to the individual susceptibility to TCE exposure.

title: Breeding of high-quality white waxy corn hybrid Liunuo 9 and its cultivation techniques.
abstract: High-quality white waxy corn hybrid Liunuo 9 is a single cross hybrid derived from crossing crossing Subject Category: Techniques, Methodologies and Equipment

title: Effect of comprehensive schistosomiasis control strategy with emphasis on infectious source control in Guichi District, Chizhou City, Anhui Province.
abstract: Objective: To evaluate the effect of the comprehensive strategy with emphasis on infectious source control for schistosomiasis schistosomiasis Subject Category: Diseases, Disorders, and Symptomssee more details control in marshland and lake regions. Methods: The comprehensive strategy with emphasis on infectious source control was implemented in the Qiupu River basin, the Changjiang and Jiuhua River basin and the Shengjin Lake basin in the years of 2006, 2007 and 2008, respectively, and 13 villages were randomly selected from 40 villages of the basins, schistosomiasis prevalence and snail status of the selected villages were observed, and the effect of the comprehensive control strategy was evaluated. Results: In the Qiupu River basin, compared with 2005, the average infection rate of residents, the density of infected snails snails Subject Category: Organism Names

title: Pesticides residue analysis of pure tea produced in Xishuangbanna state
abstract: Pesticide residue analysis of 13 pesticides for 400 samples of pure tea produced in Xishuangbanna state including 285 samples of non-fermentation tea and 114 samples of fermentation tea were detected by gas chromatography. The result showed that maximum residues of benzene hexachloride, chlorophenothane, permethrin, bifenthrin, cypermethrin, flucythrinate, esfenvalerate, deltamethrin, acephate, dimethoate, fenitrothion of non-fermentation tea were 0.113 mg/kg, 0.126 mg/kg, 0.844 mg/kg, 1.090 mg/kg, 0.304 mg/kg, 0.242 mg/kg, 0.508 mg/kg, 0.1 mg/kg, 0.032 mg/kg, 0.037 mg/kg respectively and detection rate were 26.3%, 3.2%, 2.1%, 13.0%, 17.9%, 3.5%, 2.8%, 0.35%, 4.9%, 5.3%, 5.0%. Maximum residues of benzene hexachloride, chloro-phenothane, bifenthrin, cypermethrin, flucythrinate, esfenvalerate, deltamethrin, acephate, dimethoate, fenitrothion of fermentation tea were 0.135 mg/kg, 0.103 mg/kg, 0.195 mg/kg, 0.124 mg/kg, 0.492 mg/kg, 0.138 mg/kg, 0.060 mg/kg, 0.024 mg/kg, 0.004 mg/kg, 0.001 mg/kg, 0.005 mg/kg respectively and detection rate were 42.1%, 12.3%, 7.9%, 19.3%, 19.3%, 4.4%, 8.8%, 0.88%, 2.6%, 1.7%, 2.5%. respectively. Dichlorvos and quinalphos of non-fermentation and fermentation tea were not detected.

title: Driver's face detection based on Adaboost and skin color segmentation [J]
abstract: An improved face detection algorithm based on Adaboost is used to detect the face area possibly existing in the image, the detected area is extended properly and an face detection algorithm based on skin color segmentation in RGB space is used to locate the face again in the extended area, accurate fusion detection algorithm of face is achieved by the defined area coincidence degree and the geometric features of human face. Experiment results show the robustness and real-time performance of the algorithm.

title: Sharing High Energy Physics Files on Multiple Grid Infrastructures [J]
abstract: Currently, High Energy Physics (HEP) grid platform mainly use gLite middleware and Linux operating system. Actually, more and more heterogeneous resources are integrated to support HEP applications. How to share large volumes of data across different platforms is a big challenge. A dedicated tool for HEP data sharing is proposed and implemented in this paper, which makes user access WLCG files apparently on a verity of platforms. This paper describes the tool in detail, including the architecture, implementation, performance measurement and tuning and use scenario.

title: Analysing New Cases Of Occupational Diseases During 2007 In Inner Monglia [J]
abstract: Objective To study the incidence of occupational diseases in Inner Monglia, counting and analysing new cases in 2007. Methods According to the occupational diseases reporting system of Inner Monglia, analysing it by occupational kinds, professional distribution and so on. Results There are 424 cases of new cases of occupational diseases in 2007, which is 278 cases of pneumoconiosis, 118 cases of chronic occupational poisoning, 20 cases of diseasescaused by biological factors, 8 cases of diseases caused by accut occupational poisoning, physical factors and throat diseas. Conclusion Pneumoconiosis and chronic occupational diseas is mostly occupational diseases in Inner Monglia.

title: Approximate solutions of even parity stationary states in harmonic oscillator potential with ╬┤ potential added [J]
abstract: Trial wave function was used to calculate ground state energy to obtain a relatively accurate value. After adding potential ╬┤ to one-dimensional harmonic oscillator, the odd parity stationary states of the harmonic oscillator still held and the even parity stationary states were no longer correct. Therefore, the perturbation theory and variational method were used respectively to calculate the approximate even parity stationary states, and variational method was used to solve Schrodinger equation. Results show that the calculated approximate even parity stationary states match well with the desired value, especially in excited state, the relative error is less than├ù 10-3, and all the approximate values of energy for all levels are higher than desired value, which prove that it is simple and feasible by using perturbation theory or variational method to calculate approximate even parity stationary states with ╬┤ potential added.

title: Study on Mechanism of Breaking Standing Wave Action on Vertical-wall Structure [J]
abstract: A two-dimensional numerical wave flume is established to study the breaking standing wave action on a vertical-wall structure in the case of regular wave. The calculated pressure distributions, as well as variations of the pressure time histories at points on the surface of the vertical wall, are compared with that of physical model tests. The features of breaking standing wave action were discussed and the reason of the saddle-like variations of the pressure process is analyzed. The calculated wave forces are compared with that of design code and standing wave theory. The efficiency of present numerical model is verified by the analysis and comparison.

title: Construction on the optimization designing system of shearing mechanism of rolling shear
abstract: The optimization designing system of shearing mechanism of rolling shear that integrated the optimization design of shearing mechanism with the verification of design into an organic whole has been constructed. The rationality on the selection of shearing force formulae was discussed, and the cause of production and the overcoming technology on the peak value of shearing force in the initial stage of roll cutting were analyzed. Hereon this base, let the two be syncretized into the design module, thus enhanced the scientificalness of optimization design. And the feasibility verification has been carried out on this software system; the result indicated the effectiveness of this software system.

title: The significance of serum free fatty acid changes in patient of chronic severe hepatitis B [J]
abstract: Objective To investigate the change of serum free fatty acid (FFA) in chronic severe hepatitis B (CSHB) and its clinical significance. Methods The levels of serum FFA in 120 CSHB patients, 120 chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients and 30 healthy controls were determined and compared with the level of serum total billirubin (TBil), alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and total cholesterol (TC). Results The levels of serum FFA in patients with CSHB and CHB were (1 638.6┬▒96.4) mmol/L and (626.1┬▒37.5) mmol/L, which were significantly higher than that in healthy controls [(223.1┬▒26.4) mmol/L, P0. 01, P0. 05]. The FFA levels in CSHB patients were higher than that in CHB patients (P0. 05). The levels of serum FFA in patients with CSHB and CHB were (548.1┬▒46.3) mmol/L and (228.1┬▒12.4) mmol/L after 3 weeks treatment. The FFA levels in CSHB patients were higher than that in CHB patients. The levels of serum FFA in patients with CHB had no difference compared with control group (P0. 05). Conclusions The levels of serum FFA in CSHB and CHB patients increase significantly and correlate with the severity of disease. The serum FFA level decreases after treatment. Determination of serum FFA has clinical value for the diagnosis and prognosis of CSHB.

title: Control law and characteristics of solid propellant air-turbo-rocket [J]
abstract: Mathematical model was set to study the control law and characteristics of solid propellant air-turbo-rocket (SPATR) with single and two control parameters, and the computational program based on the model was developed. In the mathematical model the total temperature of combustor exit is calculated based on interpolation of the experimental data. The velocity characteristics of SPATR with different control laws were computed in four cases which are the gas flow mass in turbine inlet is constant, the gas flow mass in turbine inlet is adjustable, the throat area of nozzle is adjustable and both the gas flow mass in turbine inlet and the throat area of nozzle are adjustable, respectively. The bivariate control law of SPATR was designed, and the adjusted ratio of gas flow mass in turbine inlet and the throat area of nozzle were obtained. Computational results show that SPATR has a wide flight envelope and better characteristics with the bivariate control law.

title: Research on Calculation Method of Target Displacement in Single Column Systems of Reinforced Concrete Bridges
abstract: The calculation method of target displacement in single column systems was summarized. Study on the material strain-based method indicated that the calculation of target displacement depended on the under pressure district height and the equivalent yield curvature of the cross-section. Section analysis software UC-Fyber was used to analyze the moment-curvature performance of square sections and circular sections. The calculation formula of the under pressure district height was educed, also equivalent yield curvature formula that accord well with the research data was educed. The formula of material strain-based target displacement was put forward that can applied to the two different section forms. Practical calculation method of target displacement was educed. Influence analysis of the section form, concrete strength grade, longitudinal reinforcement ratio, section size, and concrete pressure strain and structure height to the target displacement value was done. Measures to increase target displacement are suggested by the influence analysis result.

title: Comparison of Models for Turning Movement Capacity of Signalized Intersections Affected by Bicycles
abstract: Bicycle traffic has much effect on the capacities of turning movements at signalized intersections. This paper reviewed the prevailing analytical methods to calculate the turning movement capacities influenced by bicycles, used VISSIM to simulate the effect of bicycles, and calibrated the simulation model. A numerical example was then presented to compare the simulations with the existing analytical models. The numerical results indicate that the existing methods yield results that vary substantially. The capacities calculated by the methods of HCM (2000) and Chen (2007) fit in which the simulation experiment results better. It will result in underestimation of turning capacities to assume bicycle priority over turning vehicles, while it will lead the overestimation to merely consider the effects of bicycles crossing at the beginning of green indications. As the conflicting bicycle volumes increase, the impact of additional bicycles on vehicles decreases. The simulated capacities depend strongly on the mean turning speeds.

title: Analysis and Optimized Design of Grout Proportion for Simultaneous Grouting in Shield Tunnelling
abstract: In order to improve the workability of the grout for simultaneous grouting in shield tunneling, the grout proportion is optimized by adding sodium carbonate and calcium lignosulphonate. The influence of water/blinder ratio, fly ash/cement ratio, bentonite/water ratio, sodium carbonate amount, calcium lignosulphonate amount and cement amount on the grout performance is tested by orthogonal experiment. Finally, optimized grout proportion is suggested. This paper can provide reference for similar projects in the future.

title: A new cavitation model based on evaporation and condensation theory
abstract: Cavitation is a phenomenon which occurs where the local pressure falls off under the vapor pressure. Over the past few years, numerical simulation models for cavitation have been developed significantly in order to investigate the mechanism of cavitation. In the paper, A local homogeneous cavitation model based on the theory of evaporation and condensation has been deduced, which is used to describe the phase change between water and vapor. The RNG kΓÇô╬╡ turbulence model is used to simulate the turbulent flow and the finite volume method is employed to discrete the governing equations. The effects of surface tension of water, pressure fluctuations and non-condensable gases are included in the mass transfer cavitation model. Also in order to neglect the effects of the quantities such as the bubble number and bubble diameter, which is difficult to measure, the relations between the aerodynamic drag and┬áΓÇª

title: Study of Displacement-based Seismic Design Method for RC Bridge Piers
abstract: The displacement-based seismic design method for reinforced concrete piers was researched systematically. The moment-curvature performances of square sections and circular sections were analyzed by using section analytic software UC-Fyber and the calculation method of target displacement of RC bridge piers was educed. Elastic displacement response spectra of different damping ratios, inelastic displacement response spectra and inelastic demand spectra of different ductility coefficients were educed from acceleration spectra of Chinese specification JTGTB02-01-2008, and three simplified methods of displacement demand were developed accordingly. Design examples of the displacement demand were provided and verified by dynamic inelastic time-history analysis to clarify the reasonableness of the designs. The result shows that (1) target displacement of RC bridge piers is relevant with concrete strength grade, longitudinal reinforcement ratio, height and the section type of pier, etc;(2) calculation based on the design spectra by using equivalent linearization based method and inelastic displacement response spectra based method could both realize the target displacement and consider the structure safety requirement;(3) demand spectra based method is a simple and direct way to show design with graphics mode, while it has the deficiency that the structure capacity spectrum curve from pushover analysis is differ from the reality.

title: Study on phylogenetic relationship of freshwater planarians (Turbellaria: Tricladida: Paludicola) in nine Chinese localities using RAPD methodΓ£░
abstract: Objective. China is rich in freshwater planarian resource. In order to investigate phylogenetic relationships, Random Amplified Polymorphic DNA (RAPD) technique was applied to analyze RAPD pattern variations in planarians collected from nine Chinese localities, which belong to Dugesia japonica and Seidlia sinensis, respectively. Methods. Among 60 arbitrary primers (10 bp) under predetermined optimum reaction conditions, 27 primers were informative and yielded a total number of 314 clear and reproducible bands. The patterns show polymorphic variations among and within species. RAPD data were used to calculate Nei and Li similarity coefficient and genetic distance. Molecular systematic evolution tree was reconstructed by Nearest-Neighbor method via program SPSS 10.0. Results. The results showed that samples of D. japonica collected from eight localities clustered first, and then clustered with S. sinensis. In the clade of D. japonica, three branches are further divided. Conclusion. This clustering pattern coincides with the results drawn from the cytogenetical study, and also relates to their geographic distribution.[Life Science Journal. 2009; 6 (2): 71ΓÇô75](ISSN: 1097ΓÇô8135).

title: Development and Application of Data-driven Model in Hydrological Forecasting for Weihe River Basin [J]
abstract: There are two kinds of existing methods for hydrological forecasting, which are data-driven models and process-driven models. As the development of calculation and acquirement of hydrological data, data-driven models draw more attention in hydrological forecasting, such as regression models and neural network models. Firstly, this paper completed the interpolation of point rainfall to sub-basins based on the Reverse Distance Square (RDS) method or Thiessen Polygon method, which depend on the integrity of rainfall data. After that, autoregressive models were used for the precipitation forecasting of 10 districts of Grade 4 in the Weihe River Basin, and the results were corrected by gradually amendment of Year-Month-Ten days. For the runoff forecasting of 28 reservoirs in the Weihe River Basin, multiple linear regression model of precipitation-temperature-runoff was adopted, and the results are satisfying.[Fund]:ΓÇ£σìüΣ╕ÇΣ║öΓÇ¥ σ¢╜σ«╢τºæµèÇµö»µÆæΦ«íσêÆΦ»╛Θóÿ ΓÇ£Θ╗äµ▓│µ░┤Φ╡äµ║Éτ«íτÉåσà│Θö«µèÇµ£»σÅèΣ╕ÇΣ╜ôσîûτ«íτÉåµ£║σê╢τáöτ⌐╢ΓÇ¥(2006BAB06B06);; Φç¬τä╢τºæσ¡ªσƒ║Θçæ ΓÇ£Θ╗äσ£ƒΘ½ÿσÄƒµ╡üσƒƒµ░┤µûçτöƒµÇüΦ┐çτ¿ïτ¢╕Σ║ÆΣ╜£τö¿µ£║σê╢Σ╕ÄΦÇªσÉêµ¿íµïƒΓÇ¥(50779074);; Φç¬τä╢τºæσ¡ªσƒ║Θçæ ΓÇ£Θ╗äσ£ƒΘ½ÿσÄƒµ░┤µ▓ÖΦ┐çτ¿ïσ░║σ║ªµòêσ║öΣ╕Äµ¿íµïƒΓÇ¥(50709041)

title: Multistage Image Encryption Based on TD-ERCS Chaotic System [J]
abstract: Due to the good properties of sensitivity, ergodic property and miscibility to initial conditions and parameters that chaos has and chaotic image encryption is a high efficient method, a multistage image encryption scheme was proposed based on Tangent Delay Ellipse Reflecting Cavity Map (TD-ERCS), which utilized TD-ERCS chaotic system to generate groups of discrete chaotic and chose one of groups to an address index list to scramble the positions of the image pixels in the spatial domain overall; then chose the remaining groups in a certain way to do the encryption operation byte by byte during the diffusion process of pixel values. The findings show that encryption scheme is good at concealing the relationship between the plain image and the encrypted image, and has high security to certain analysis and attack vectors.

title: Measurement and Error Analysis of Overhead Line Arc Sag with Large Pole Span [J]
abstract: Many factors could affect the overhead line arc sag with large pole span, and effective means of precise measurement and error analysis of the arc sag is unavailable. Taking the first 750 kV double-circuit lines on the same tower in Northwest Grid as example, this paper analyzes the three measuring methods of the arc sag, investigates the functions of the theodolite to prevent the measurement error at the center pile to comply with the measuring requirement in the overhead line engineering with large pole span. The analysis software has been drafted for the onsite application to measure the line arc sag precisely and efficiently.

title: A-nalysis on sag measurement and its error of 750kV transmission line
abstract: The methods of sag measurement is analyzed during the acceptance of the completion and routine maintenance work in the first northwest 750 kV double transmission lines on the same tower, and the measurement error of pile center, where theodolite is located in, is studied to meet the requirements of engineering measurement. Analysis software is compiled in accordance with application on site to realize the rapid measurement of sag in transmission line.

title: Structural Improvement and Optimization of Spindle Box in a Coiling Machine Based on Finite Element Method [J]
abstract: In order to study the vibration characteristics of the spindle box in a coiling machine, the software COSMOS based on finite element method was employed to do the resonant analysis and structural optimization. The first 10 order resonant modes were simulated, numerical results showed that the fundamental resonant frequency is relatively low, just equal to 767 Hz, and corresponding to a deformation ratio of 1.31%, and that the second order resonant frequency is 801 Hz, resulting in a deformation ratio of 1.19%. According to these results, the working speed of the coiling machine is limited to a very low level. Strengthening ribs were designed to optimize the structure of the spindle box, resulting in an increase of the fundamental vibration frequency by 5.4% and an increase of the second order vibration frequency by 23.6%. The sensitivity of the vibration frequency was investigated, and the distance of the middle support plate was optimized. By using strengthening ribs, the fundamental vibration frequency was increased by 28.7% through optimizing the distance of the middle support plate..

title: Tissue Culture and Plantlet Regeneration of Solanum texanum L.
abstract: Using the cotyledon and hypocotyls as explants, the influence of growth regulators were studied on differentia-tion and the regeneration in Solanum texanum L.. The optimum medium for cotyledon was MS+ ZT 1.0 mg/L+ 6-BA 2.0 mg/L, the rate of regeneration was 70.00%. The optimum medium for hypocotyl was MS+ ZT 1.0 mg/L, the rate of regeneration was 35.15%. The optimum medium for rooting was MS+ IAA 0.5 mg/L, the rate of rooting was 100%.

title: Design of transmitting module for ionospheric oblique backscattering sounding system [J]
abstract: To meet the technical requirements of low transmitting power, long sounding distance, perfect anti-interference for wuhan ionospheric oblique backscattering sounding system (WIOBSS), a new sounding mode of binary phase-coding, transmission and reception in equal interval is introduced according to the character of WIOBSS. In this sounding mode, the sounding signal with long duration is emitted to integrate the power of echoes in WIOBSS. Furthermore, the pseudo-random codes with perfect autocorrelation function, such as m sequence and almost perfect sequence, are adopted to modulate the phase of emitted signals. In addition, according to the techniques of software radio and Pci eXtension for instrumentation (PXI) bus, a set of software-based transmitting module is designed to realize this new sounding mode. The experimental results show that with this transmitting module, WIOBSS successfully achieves the sounding of ionosphere condition in the range of 2 000 km under very low transmitting power.

title: Development of the simulation system for marine main engine local manoeuvring
